She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Abegail

texts.en: Abegail is 20 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. Abegail  has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Abegail became a member of HSPFI in 2012. In the future, Abegail hopes to improve her business for the education of her child.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 37 years old and married with 6 children.

Mary Jane is in the agricultural business, growing bananas in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Mary Jane has been growing bananas for 2 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF, and more recently from Kiva, to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 57 years old and has 5 children. Daisy is married and has 3 children who are in school.

Daisy is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Daisy requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and medicine for her pigs.

Daisy has been raising pigs for 4 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Daisy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college, and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicine for her pigs.

loans.name: Rhodora

texts.en:
Rhodora is 46 years old and single.

Rhodora is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy more feed for her pigs.

Rhodora has been raising pigs for 6 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF, and more recently from Kiva, to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more feed for her pigs

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet works hard to support her family. She is married and has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines.

Juliet requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy more materials for her abaca weaving.

She has been in this business for 4 years now, and also earns additional income from raising livestock.

In the future, Juliet would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her abaca weaving.

loans.name: Dorina

texts.en:
Dorina is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 
Dorina is selling RTW's in their local community. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 4,000 to buy stocks of RTW's to re-sell like t shirts, pants and skirts.
Dorina has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Dorina hopes to improve her business in order to provide for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of RTW'S (ready-to-wear clothing) to re-sell

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is 58 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Pacita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and medicine for her pigs.

Pacita has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from raha making.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicine for her pigs.

loans.name: Liezyl

texts.en: Liezyl is 31 years old and married with three children. With all her children in school, Liezyl works very hard to provide for them. Liezyl runs a sari sari (general) store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her store. Liezyl has been in this business for three years, and she sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, canned goods and other grocery products. In the future, Liezyl would like to save money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Lucel

texts.en:
Lucel is 29 years old and married.

Lucel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a grocery store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell.

Lucel has borrowed and paid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the grocery store for a year and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Lucel aspires to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks to sell in her grocery store

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 34 years old and married with 2 children.

Mariam works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell.

Mariam has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from selling "copra" (dried coconut meat).

Mariam aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is married with 6 children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Mercy is 38 years old and has 4 children who are in school.

Mercy has a fishing business in the Philippines. Mercy requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials for fishing boat maintenance.

Mercy has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Mercy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials for fishing boat maintenance

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buying and selling of rice grains business in the Philippines.

Milagros requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

Milagros has been in this business for 8 years now.

In the future, Milagros would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Nadou Huguette Seth's Group

texts.fr: Il s'agit d'un groupe de deux personnes en caution solidaire. Nadou Huguette, la responsable, est âgée de 33 ans. Mariée et mère de trois enfants scolarisés dans une école de la ville, Nadou Huguette a une boutique où elle vend des sacs de maïs depuis quelques années et s'approvisionne dans les villages du Bénin. En vue d'augmenter son capital et de répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Nadou Huguette a sollicité et a obtenu un concours auprès de Finadev. Ce concours lui permettra de contribuer à la scolarisation de ses enfants et d'améliorer le régime alimentaire de sa famille. Nadou Huguette se retrouve à gauche de la photo.
texts.en:
These two women are mutually guaranteeing their group loan. Nadou Huguette, the leader, is 33 years old. Married and the mother of three children attending a local school, Nadou Huguette has a shop where she has been selling sacks of corn for several years, and for which she gets her supplies in the villages of Benin.

With an eye to increasing her capital and meeting customer demand, Nadou Huguette has sought and obtained financial assistance from Finadev. This assistance will allow her to contribute to the education of her children and to improve the family's diet. Nadou Huguette is the woman at left in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase eight sacks of corn.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 7 children. 
Julieta makes and sells tomb plaques in their community. She has had this business for 9 years. She requested a loan for 4,000 to buy raw materials used in making tomb plaques like white cement and ink for lettering names.
Julieta has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Julieta hopes to improve her business in order to provide for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy raw materials used in making tomb plaques

loans.name: Bibiane

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de cinq enfants scolarisés dont le plus âgé a 15 ans et le moins âgé a 05 ans, Bibiane s'est spécialisée dans la vente des céréales depuis des années. Elle s'approvisionne dans les villages du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son chiffre d'affaire afin de combler les attentes de sa clientèle qui augmentent sans cesse compte tenu du bon emplacement de son fonds de commerce, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit auprès de Finadev. Le présent crédit lui permettra d'acheter des sacs de maïs, de gari et d'haricot. Bibiane avec ses économies veut participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants et améliorer le niveau de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Married and the mother of five children in school - the eldest 15 years old and the youngest five years old - Bibiane has been specializing in the sale of cereals for years. She gets her supplies in the villages of Benin.

With the goal of increasing her sales in order to meet the expectations of her customer base, which is growing continuously due to the good location of her business, Bibiane has sought and obtained a microloan from Finadev. The current loan will allow her to purchase sacks of corn, gari [coarse cassava flour] and beans.

With her savings, Bibiane wants to contribute to the educational expenses of her children and to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase eight sacks of corn, one sack of gari [coarse cassava flour], and one sack of beans.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.en:
Nieves is 49 years old and married with 9 children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Nieves is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Nieves has been farming rice for 26 years and also earns additional income from a sari sari store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to repair and renovate her family home and send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farms supplies

loans.name: Seynabou

texts.fr: Madame Seynabou habite au Sénégal. Elle exerce l’activité d’enseignante mais évolue parallèlement dans le domaine du commerce ou elle capitalise une expérience de 5 ans dans la vente des accessoires de femmes. Elle est mariée et participe dans les charges du foyer. Elle assure le paiement des factures d’eau et d’électricité. Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC  ou elle a déjà remboursé un prêt antérieur. Elle sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs prévu pour l’achat accessoires de femmes a vendre. Elle souhaite renforcer son fond de roulement, accroitre ses bénéfices  afin de mieux supporter ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Mrs. Seynabou lives in Senegal. She works as a teacher but is also advancing in the business sector, where she capitalizes on five years of experience in the sale of women's accessories.

She is married and contributes to the household expenses. She sees to the payment of the water and electricity bills. She is a member of one of the branches of UIMCEC, where she has already repaid a previous loan.

Mrs. Seynabou is seeking a loan of 200,000 francs intended for the purchase of women's accessories to sell. She hopes to strengthen her working capital and increase her profits in order to better meet her personal needs.

loans.use: To purchase women's accessories intended for sale.

loans.name: Maguatte

texts.fr: Madame Maguatte est une femme mariée qui s’active dans le secteur de la restauration depuis un an. Elle est sociétaire d’un guichet de l’U-IMCEC  et sollicite un crédit de 150 000 qui sera destiné  a l’augmentation de son fond de roulement. Elle compte acheter des denrées en quantités plus  importantes  et a des prix plus compétitifs dans l’objectif d’élargir son activité, elle souhaite recruter un employé qui pourra la seconder  ce qui pourra l’aider a accroitre les revenus générés. Ceci lui permettra de mieux supporter les frais scolaires de ses enfants comme participation dans les charges du foyer et aussi d’épargner de l’argent pour son projet futur qui consiste à acquérir un grand magasin au niveau du marché de sa localité et aussi obtenir  un poulailler.
texts.en: Mrs. Maguatte is a married woman who has been working in the food services industry for a year. She is a member of a branch of UIMCEC and is seeking a loan of 150,000 francs, which will be used to increase her working capital. She plans to purchase goods in larger quantities and have more competitive prices. With the objective of expanding her business, she would like to take on an employee who will be able to assist her, which could help her to generate more revenue. This will allow her to better sustain the school fees of her children, contribute to the household expenses and also to save money for her future plans, which include purchasing a large shop at the local market and securing a henhouse.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs for the preparation of her meals.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena works hard to support her family. Rowena is single and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of PHP 19,500 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business.

Rowena has been in this business for eight years now. In the future, Rowena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Tossavi Cécile

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de quatre enfants dont un est encore à l'université, Tossavi Cécile vend des céréales, de l'huile et de divers divers depuis des années. Elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin et ses clients sont composés essentiellement des habitants du quartier et ses environs. Expérimentée dans le crédit, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un concours auprès de Finadev en vue de renforcer sa capacité d'approvisionnement et de satisfaire la demande de ses clients. Le présent concours lui permettra de contribuer à la scolarisation de ses enfants et d'améliorer le régime alimentaire de sa famille.
texts.en:
Married and the mother of four children, one of whom is still in college, Tossavi Cécile has been selling cereals, oil and various other goods for years. She gets her supplies in one of Benin's markets and her customers are made up mostly of those who live in the neighborhood and surrounding area.

Experienced in [micro]credit, she has sought and obtained financial assistance from Finadev with the goal of strengthening her supply capabilities and of meeting customer demand. This assistance will allow her to contribute to the expenses of her children's education and to improve her family's diet.

loans.use: To purchase 25kg of corn, 20kg of gari [coarse cassava flour], 25 liters of oil, three boxes of canned goods, one box of soap, five trays of eggs and two boxes of sugar.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 
Marife sells snacks in her village - such as cassava cake and banana cake. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients to make snacks - such as sugar, margarine, cheese, flour, cassava chips and banana chips.
Marife has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Marife hopes to improve her business, in order to help educate her children.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to make snacks.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
This is Teresita, aged 61 and resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Rodolfo. She, together with her husband, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Teresita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Teresita earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 400 in sales every day.
To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 40,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Teresita hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of supplies and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Margery

texts.en:
Margery is 41 years old and is married with three children.

Margery works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Margery has been in this business for 10 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Margery aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 
Adela sells ready to wear clothes in her local community. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy stocks of ready to wear products to re-sell - such as t-shirts, pants and skirts.
Adela has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Adela hopes to improve her business in order to help educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more ready to wear clothes to re-sell.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 50 years old. She is married and has five children, one of whom is in school.

Wilma is in the agricultural business of hog raising. Wilma requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and medicine for her pigs.

Wilma has been hog raising for 15 years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Wilma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicine for her pigs.

loans.name: Ruby Flora

texts.en:
Ruby Flora is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials for fishing boat repairs.

Ruby Flora has been in this business for 13 years. Ruby Flora earns additional income from food vending.

Ruby Flora has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for fishing boat repairs.

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre de 46 años, vive en la ciudad de Camaná, tiene 2 hijos, a quienes quiere mucho, ellos ya son mayores y cada uno tiene su propia familia; lastimosamente por diversas circunstancias desde hace varios años decidió separarse de su esposa; el siempre ha sido una persona muy alegre, entusiasta y trabajador, que ha dedicado todos sus esfuerzos para sacar adelante a sus hijos; lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar y solventar sus gastos no pudo cursar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo; en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus hijos y amigos y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Saltado de Carne para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia y gracias al apoyo de sus hijos, Luis se dedica a la agricultura, el cuenta con una pequeña parcela donde siembra frejoles, desde tempranas horas de la mañana Luis se dedica a realizar diversas labores de campo, el puede trabajar un aproximado de 10 horas diarias y se encuentra muy a gusto con el trabajo que realiza ya que siempre le ha gustado el campo.
Luis se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos y el mantenimiento de su cultivo, comprando el abono necesario; de esta manera podrá mantener su cultivo en buenas condiciones y así cuando su cosecha termine podrá obtener buenas ganancias, con las cuales en un futuro no muy lejano espera poder cultivar diversos sembríos.
texts.en:
Luis, 46, lives in the city of Camaná and has two children, who he adores.  They are adults now and have their own families.  Unfortunately, due to different circumstances, several years ago he decided to divorce his wife.  He has always been a very cheerful, enthusiastic and hard-working person and has dedicated much effort to providing for his children.   Out of necessity, he had to work and earn a living, so he was unable to get professional training, but would have liked to.  In his free time he plays soccer with his sons and friends, and sometimes makes a delicious "Saltado de Carne" meat dish to share with his family.

On his own initiative, and thanks to the support of his children, Luis became a farmer and has a small patch of land where he grows beans.  He gets up very early in the morning to carry out his different farm chores and works around ten hours a day.  He enjoys his work because he has always liked the countryside.

Luis is very grateful to Kiva lenders, because thanks to their help he can cover crop expenses and maintenance, and also buy the necessary fertilizer.  This means he will be able to keep his crop in good condition and earn a good profit at harvest time.  This will allow him to begin growing different crops in the near future.

loans.use: To cover crop expenses and maintenance, and buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
This is Alberto. He previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that he used to buy spare parts and accessories and pay for the maintenance of his Jeepney unit. His earnings were a big help for the household and business expenditures. 

He would like to apply for another 17,000 PHP loan for him to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their Jeepney unit. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily life. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart. 

Alberto dreams of having another vehicle and hopes to give his family a good future. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of his Jeepney unit.

loans.name: Nila

texts.en:
Nila is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Nila and her husband have a repair shop that repairs different kinds of vehicles. She has had this business for nine years. She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy tools and pay for the electricity for the services.

Nila became a member of HSPFI in 2012. In the future, Nila hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy tools used in her repair shop.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is from Calabayan, Ozamiz City. She is 45 years old, married, and has four adult children. Evelyn used her last loan to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Her business grew and become successful. 

Now she's taking a new loan to purchase farm chemicals. She is positive and hopes to grow her business even more.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals.

loans.name: Oeu

texts.en:
Oeu is 59 years old, a resident of Baray district of Kompong Tom province. He has a common law relationship with his wife and has eight children. Five of his children are already settled for marriage while the other three are single. Oeu’s living completely depends on his agricultural businesses, including a farming and a fishing business. Oeu, together with his wife, usually go fishing along the Tonle Sap River and bring fish to sell in a local market of the province, earning approximately USD 3.00 per day. He has been doing the business for almost 17 years.

Oeu wants a motorcycle to transport his fish to the marketplaces, but due to insufficient funds he would like to take out a loan to add to his savings to purchase a used motorcycle. Oeu is very happy with the given loan because it’ll help the family for their business and personal uses. Oeu has already paid off his previous loans successfully as it is now his third loan from HKL.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle.

loans.name: Duo Esperanza De Santiago Group

texts.es: Dúo esperanza de Santiago. Integrado por doña Alicia casada y tiene un hijo su esposo trabaja como carpintero doña Alicia quien se dedica a la venta de pan todos los días de lunes a domingo, mañana y tarde. Abre su local desde temprano las 06:00 am y en la tarde cierra hasta la 09:00 pm, su local se encuentra cerca del mercado municipal de Santiago Sac y pues tiene muy buenas ganancias, doña Alicia necesita darle mayor presentación a su negocio además de que vende chiles rellenos dos veces por  semana y le va muy bien aprovecha las épocas y el lugar para variar sus ventas frente a su negocio a parte de la venta de pan.Esta solicitando este credito para la compra de pan por mayor y asi mejorar sus ventas y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The communal bank, Dúo Esperanza de Santiago, includes Alicia, who is married and has a son.  Her husband is a carpenter and she sells bread for a living every day of the week, mornings and afternoons.  She opens early at 6:00 a.m. and closes at 9:00 p.m.  Her shop is near the municipal market of Santiago Sac and earns a good profit.

Alicia wants to renovate the shop where she also sells stuffed peppers twice a week.  Se takes advantage of the different seasons and her location to vary the product she has on offer in addition to bread.  She is requesting a loan to buy bread wholesale to improve sales and help her family.

loans.use: To buy bread to sell.

loans.name: María Jacinta

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Nueva Esperanza  se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Calderón del cantón Portoviejo, lugar de gente noble y trabajadora dedicada en su mayoría a las faenas del campo y el comercio.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María, tiene 50 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos todos mayores de edad,  uno de ellos aun vive con ella. Su esposo es policía jubilado.

Nuestra amiga es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de productos naturales, nos cuenta que tiene buena clientela que siempre le piden sus productos, trabaja tres días de la semana de dos a tres horas al dia, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene tres años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, nos cuenta que lo que más vende son las vitaminas y ciertos productos que ayudan a bajar de peso.

Este crédito es para comprar productos naturales ya que tiene un buen pedido. Este es el segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le facilitan su negocio. 

Su sueño es tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank Nueva Esperanza meets every two weeks in the Calderón Parish in Portoviejo Canton, where noble, hard-working people live and work, mainly in agriculture and commerce.

Here we met María, 50, who is married and has five children, all adults, one of whom still lives with her.  Her husband is a retired policeman.

Our friend is a homemaker who, in order to earn her own income and help her husband with household expenses, sells natural products.  She says she has a good number of customers who always place orders.  She works three days a week, around two to three hours a day, and sells on a credit basis, collecting payment every eight days.  For three years she has been in business and it is going well.  What she sells most are vitamins and certain weight-loss products.

The loan will be used to buy natural products since she has a large order to fill.  This is her second loan through the communal bank which she likes because the loans make running her business easier.

Her dream is to stay healthy.

loans.use: To buy natural products.

loans.name: Nobie

texts.en:
Nobie is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Nobie sells dried fish in their local community. She has had this business for seven years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of dried fish to re-sell.

Nobie became a member of HSPFI in 2012. In the future, Nobie hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of dried fish to re-sell.

loans.name: Alina

texts.en:
Alina is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. Alina has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She had this business for seven years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Alina became a member of HSPFI in 2012. In the future, Alina hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Judelyn

texts.en:
Judelyn is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. Judelyn has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for six years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Judelyn became a member of HSPFI in 2012. In the future, Judelyn hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Yolesa

texts.en:
Yolesa is married with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Yolesa is 42 years old and has five children who are in school.

Yolesa has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Yolesa requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell.

Yolesa has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Yolesa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 62 years old and widowed with one child.

Annie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

Annie has borrowed and paid for 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from pig-fattening.

Annie aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 45 years old and married with four children.

Estrella works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Estrella has borrowed and paid for 31 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 19 years and also earns an income from making hollow blocks and corn and coconut farming.

Estrella aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Doris Sonia

texts.es:
Doris tiene 37 años, vive en la ciudad de mala, la ciudad de mala se caracteriza por su clima cálido, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de maíz, algodón, entre otros, asimismo posee playas hermosas en las cuales uno puede apreciar la naturaleza y desconectarse de la ciudad, también se caracteriza por su rica gastronomía en la cual destacan los riquísimos Chicharrones. Doris es una mujer valiente, ha sacado adelante a sus 4 hijos, cuyas edades comprende 6, 17,19 y 23 años, por quienes da la vida y cada día se esfuerza mucho para darles una vida digna y ellos en especial los mayores la apoyan mucho en su trabajo. Doris en su tiempo libre le gusta mucho cocinar, en especial le gusta preparar postres y sobre todo su platillo favorito el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con pato”. Con mucha pena Doris nos cuenta que debido a los pocos recursos económicos que tenían sus padres ella solo pudo estudiar hasta el nivel secundario, pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar repostería.

Con mucho cariño y esfuerzo Doris trabaja en su negocio de venta de abarrotes, gas domestico, ropa, flores, entre otros, ella trabaja en su negocio alrededor de 12 horas al día ya que se levanta desde muy temprano para poder vender sus productos en especial a las amas de casa que envían a su hijos a las escuelas ya que ella comprar productos para preparar las loncheras, desayunos, entre otros; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque le gusta trabajar y ama su trabajo ya que con ello puede solventar los gastos  de su hogar.

Doris eta muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar abarrotes como fideos, conservas, atún enlatado, golosinas, gaseosas, jugos empaquetados, entre otros, asimismo ropa para niños, damas entre otros, con esta mejora tener mayor variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y poder mejorar sus ingresos, lo que le permitirá seguir creciendo cada dia y poder seguir luchando en busca de hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle a su hijos una profesión y seguir creciendo en su negocio”.
texts.en:
Doris, 37, lives in the city of Mala which is known for its warm climate and agricultural acitivty, especially growing of crops such as corn, cotton and others.  It also has beautiful beaches where one can appreciate nature and disconnect from city life.  It is also known for its tasty gastronomy and delicious pork cracklings.  Doris is a courageous woman who has raised four children, ages 6, 17, 19 and 23.  She has worked hard every day to give them a decent life, and the eldest children help her a lot in her work.  In her free time she enjoys cooking, especially making desserts and her favorite dish, which is "Arroz con pato" (duck and rice).  With much regret, Doris tells us that because her parents had few resources she was unable to get a secondary education, but she would have liked to study baking.

With a lot of affection and effort, Doris works in her business selling groceries, domestic gas, clothing, flowers, etc.  She works around 12 hours a day and gets up very early in the morning to sell products to homemakers who have to make lunches for their children to go to school, and breakfast food.  She believes business is successful because she is kind to her customers and enjoys her work, which also contributes toward her household expenses.

Doris is very grateful to Kiva lenders, thanks to whom she can buy groceries such as noodles, canned goods, tuna, sweets, sodas, packaged juice, etc., as well as children's and women's clothing, which means she will have more variety to offer customers.  This will allow her to improve her income and continue expanding daily, so she can work toward her goal of "Giving her children a profession and expanding her business".

loans.use: To buy merchandise (noodles, canned goods, tuna, sweets, sodas, packaged juice, etc.).

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 60 years old and married with two children.

Alicia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a gasoline retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional containers of gasoline to sell.

Alicia has borrowed and paid for eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the gasoline retail for five years and also earns an income from fishing.

Alicia aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To buy additional containers of gasoline to sell.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Julieta buys and sells pigs in the market for meat. She has had this business for seven years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more pigs to sell in the market for meat.

Julieta became a member of HSPFI in 2012. In the future, Julieta hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more pigs.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia works hard to support her family. Rosalia is married and has a fish dealing business in the Philippines.

Rosalia requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell.

Rosalia has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Rosalia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling spices in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy different kind of spices to sell in her buying and selling of spices business.

Rosemarie has been in this business for three years. Rosemarie earns additional income from fish vending.

Rosemarie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: To buy different kind of spices to sell.

loans.name: Juana Angelica

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Nueva Esperanza  se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Calderón del cantón Portoviejo, lugar de gente noble y trabajadora dedicada en su mayoría a las faenas del campo y el comercio.

En este lugar vive la señora Juana, tiene 38 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 14, 12 y 11 años, los dos mayores  estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. El marido es comerciante.
 
Nuestra amiga realiza el crédito para el esposo el cual se dedica a la venta de carne de cerdo, nos cuenta que el tiene una carnicería en el mercado local en el cual todos los días se dedica a esta actividad, para obtener mejores ganancias él se desplaza a los campos lugar donde compra los cerdos en pie y luego los lleva a los centros de faenamiento, luego lleva la carne a su local para que cuando lleguen sus cliente encuentren de la mejor carne para llevar a sus hogares, él lleva 14 años con este negocio el cual le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia.

Este crédito es para comprar cerdos. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten ayudar a su esposo de alguna manera.
 
Su sueño es tener una tienda de víveres.
texts.en:
The communal bank Nueva Esperanza meets every two weeks in the Calderón Parish in Portoviejo Canton, where noble, hard-working people live and work, mainly in agriculture and commerce.

Here we met Juana, 38, who has a common-law husband and three children, ages 14, 12 and 11, who are all in school.  Her husband is a merchant.

Our friend is taking out a loan for her husband who sells pork.  He has a butcher shop in the local market and works every day.  To increase his profit he goes directly to the farms to buy live pigs and then takes them to an abbatoir.  He then takes the meat to his shop directly so his customers can buy the freshest meat for their households.  He has been in business for 14 years and it has allowed him to support his family.

This loan is to buy pigs.  Juana has been in the communal bank since its beginning and she likes the loans because they allow her to help her husband in some way.

Her dream is to have a grocery store.

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children. 

Annie sells barbeque in their local community. She has had this business for nine years. She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy meat and spices to use to make barbeque.

Annie became a member of HSPFI in 2012. In the future,Annie hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more fresh meat to make barbeque.

loans.name: Flocerfida

texts.en:
Flocerfida is 49 years old and widowed with eight children.

Flocerfida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell.

Flocerfida has borrowed and paid for 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from rice grain retail.

Flocerfida aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a beauty saloon business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to purchase additional items for her beauty saloon.

Melinda has been in this business for 10 years. Melinda earns additional income from selling used clothes.

Melinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional items for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en: Mercedita is a married woman who has five children. She is 43 years old and resides in Calabayan, Ozamis City, Philippines. Mercedita used her last loan to purchase additional products to sell. Her business is successful, and she's taking a new loan for her farm business to purchase fertilizers such as manure. In the future she hopes to be able to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Elka Sugey

texts.es:
Elka es una mujer de 30 años, vive en la ciudad de Camaná con su pareja y su pequeño hijo de 10 años, ella siempre ha sido una persona muy alegre, entusiasta y trabajadora, que junto con su pareja han unido sus esfuerzos para salir adelante; lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar y solventar sus gastos no pudo cursar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder estudiar la carrera de Veterinaria; en sus ratos libres le gusta ver películas junto con su pequeño y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Picante de Cochayullo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia y gracias al apoyo de su pareja, Elka se dedica a la agricultura, ella cuenta con una pequeña parcela donde siembra frejoles, desde tempranas horas de la mañana Elka se dedica a realizar diversas labores de campo, ella puede trabajar un aproximado de 10 horas diaria y se encuentra muy a gusto con el trabajo que realiza ya que siempre le ha gustado el campo.
Elka se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos y el mantenimiento de su cultivo, comprando el abono necesario; de esta manera podrá mantener su cultivo en buenas condiciones y así cuando su cosecha termine podrá obtener buenas ganancias, con las cuales en un futuro no muy lejano espera poder cultivar diversos sembríos y con ello espera poder asegurar el futuro y bienestar de su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
Elka is a 30-year-old woman who lives in the town of Camaná with her partner and her 10-year-old son.  She has always been a very cheerful, enthusiastic and hard-working person and she has joined forces with her partner in order to make progress.  Sadly, owing to her need to work and cover her costs, Elka was not able to study for a degree.  She would really like to have been able to study for a degree in veterinary medicine.  In her free time, she enjoys watching movies together with her little one and sometimes she enjoys cooking a delicious 'picante de Cochayullo' to share with her family.

Through her own initiative and thanks to her partner's support, Elka works as a farmer.  She has a small plot of land where she grows beans.  From very early in the morning, Elka carries out her farm work.  She can work approximately 10 hours a day and is very happy with the work that she does because she has always liked farming.

Elka is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to the help they provide, she will be able to cover her costs and maintain her crops, buying the fertilizer she needs.  This will enable her to keep her crops in good condition and, when she finishes harvesting, she will make good profits which, in the not-so-distant future, she hopes to be able to use to start growing different crops.  This will enable her to guarantee her young son's future and well-being.

loans.use: to cover the cost of maintaining her crops.  To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Elivil

texts.en:
Elivil is 39 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Elivil is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Elivil has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a furniture-making business in the Philippines.

Gina requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy raw materials for her furniture-making business.

She has been in this business for 30 years.

In the future, Gina would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her furniture-making business.

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Maria Elena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari business.

NWTF is relisting Maria Elena's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Sofronia

texts.en:
Sofronia is 62 years old and married with five children.

Sofronia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

Sofronia has borrowed and paid for five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Sofronia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita works hard to support her family. Rosita is married and has a business selling coconut wine in the Philippines.

Rosita requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional containers of coconut wine to sell.

Rosita has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Rosita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional containers of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine works hard to support her family. Josephine is married and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

Josephine requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell.

Josephine has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Josephine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Wendy

texts.en:
Wendy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment for fishing.

NWTF is listing Wendy's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and other equipment for fishing.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Arlene sells vegetables, spices and fish in their community market. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy stocks of vegetables, spices and fish to re-sell.

Arlene became a member of HSPFI in 2012. In the future, Arlene hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables, spices and fish to re-sell.

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia is 65 years old, married, and has 10 children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Arsenia has a business selling livestock in the Philippines. Arsenia requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy more livestock.

Arsenia has been in this business for five years. In the future, Arsenia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more livestock.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 52 years old and married with seven children.

Gloria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 49,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like rice grains, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Gloria has borrowed and paid for 24 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 30 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Gloria aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items like rice grains and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is married with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Amelita is 48 years old and has two children who are in school.

Amelita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Amelita requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials to repair her fishing boat.

Amelita has been in this business for 26 years. In the future, Amelita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials to repair her fishing boat.

loans.name: Nestoria

texts.en:
Nestoria works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines.

Nestoria requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fruit to sell on her food stall.

She has been in this business for 17 years.

In the future, Nestoria would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell on her food stall.

loans.name: Maria Esmeralda

texts.es: María Esmeralda de 29 años de edad, con tres hijos menores de edad, tiene por actividad económica una pulpería desde hace 1 años, el cual está ubicado en su casa de habitación. Inicio el negocio para mejorar sus niveles de vida, el financiamiento lo quiere para invertir en capital de trabajo como: arroz, azúcar, leña, pan, huevos, jabón de baños, jabón de lavar, frutas, verduras, productos de consumo diario para el hogar.
texts.en: María Esmeralda is 29 years old and has three dependent children.  She has been running a grocery store in her home for one year.  She started the business to improve her family's standard of living.  She would like this loan to invest in buying rice, sugar, firewood, bread, eggs, soap, laundry detergent, fruit, vegetables and other staples.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, firewood, bread, eggs, soap, laundry detergent, fruit, vegetables and other staples

loans.name: Batdelger

texts.en:
Mr. Batdelger, 29, is a driver and works as a truck driver in the blacksmith factory. He lives with his wife and his three children in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. Before he was a herder and used to herd sheep, horse and cows in the countryside. But his family moved to the city due to the heavy freezes of consecutive years in Mongolia. His family owns an old house and small land plot in the ger district. A ger is a Mongolian nomadic tent. Since his house was built, it never had any complete repair or renovations. Currently it looses a lot of heat through the old floor, ceiling and entrance hall. This is why he has decided to make repairs and insulate them. He totally hopes that his cost for coal fuel will be cut after the repair. 

Although Mongolia has the lowest population density in the world, it is one of the most polluted countries in the world. This is due to the long and cold winters where temperatures frequently go below -40C (-40F) even in the cities.  Also, in winter, many parts of the country are extremely cold and are known to have snow storms.  Both homes and nomadic tents burn a lot of fuel and emit huge amounts of pollution every night from families just trying to stay warm. As well, the extremely toxic smoke from the cars is one of main reason of Mongolian hard air pollution. In response to this, Credit Mongol offers Green Loans to their clients to make home improvements that reduce heat loss, improve heating systems and buy the cars on the natural gas. We believe that together we can decrease pollution and the harmful effects it has on the environment and Mongolians' health. The loan he is taking will used to cover the costs for his house repair.

loans.use: To cover the costs of his house repair.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Gorgonia

texts.en:
Gorgonia is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with nine children. 

Gorgonia and her husband have a repair shop that repairs damaged motorcycles. She has had this business for nine years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy tools and pay for the electricity for the services.

Gorgonia became a member of HSPFI in 2012. In the future, Gorgonia hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy tools for the repair shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials for making hollow blocks to use for construction.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Lucy has a vegetable garden that produces squash and bitter melon during harvest time. She has had this business for nine years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy fertilizers for the vegetable garden.

Lucy became a member of HSPFI in 2012. In the future, Lucy hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the vegetables.

loans.name: Estella

texts.en:
This is Estella. She previously accessed an 11,000 PHP loan that she used to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her child and in their personal, house hold and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Estella hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she fervently hopes that her children will be able to finish their studies and graduate one day. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Lkhasuren

texts.en:
Mr. Lkhasuren, 37, works as a driver in a private company. He lives with his family in his recently purchased house and land plot in the ger district, an area of the city with no running water, minimal roads and spotty electricity in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His house has some problems such as heat loss and damages to its roof, inside walls etc. This is why he is planning to make repairs and insulate them using rock wool, cement and red bricks. Also he will replace his furnace which uses smoky coal with a smokeless one. He thinks his home will be warmer after the wall and roof insulation and a new smart furnace. 

Although Mongolia has the lowest population density in the world, it is one of the most polluted countries in the world. This is due to the long and cold winters where temperatures frequently go below -40C (-40F) even in the cities. Also, in winter, many parts of the country are extremely cold and are known to have snow storms. Both homes and nomadic tents burn a lot of fuel and emit huge amounts of pollution every night from families just trying to stay warm. As well, the extremely toxic smoke from the cars is one of main reason of Mongolian hard air pollution. In response to this, Credit Mongol offers Green Loans to their clients to make home improvements that reduce heat loss, improve heating systems and buy the cars on the natural gas. We believe that together we can decrease pollution and the harmful effects it has on the environment and Mongolians' health. The loan he is taking will used to buy some building materials and new smokeless furnace for his home repair.

loans.use: To buy some building materials and a new smokeless furnace for his home repair.

loans.name: Chum

texts.en:
Chum, 37, is a single parent who lives with her only child in Baray district of Kompong Tom province. In her yard, Chum built a wooden piggery where she installed piglets to fatten. She can generate a good income after 4 to 5 month of raising the pigs. She sells them to local traders. However, the primary business of the family is rice husbandry. Chum owns a few pieces of land, on which she plants rice in both seasons of the year. Also, she has her child to help her in the two businesses.

Chum wants to earn a consistent income for her child’s education. In this regard, she has applied for a loan of KHR 800,000 to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for growing her dry-season rice. She hopes that lenders will continually help her through the loan for the improvements of her business. She believes that she will have a good harvest in the coming crop season.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for growing her dry-season rice.

loans.name: Simeona

texts.en:
This is Simeona. She previously accessed an 14,000 PHP loan that she utilized to buy things needed for planting such as fertilizer, pots, seedlings, plastics, and wires. Her earnings were a big help for their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan she will be using to buy fertilizer and garden inputs for her business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart

Simeona hopes her business grows in the coming years and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship meeting* where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for gardening materials and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Erika Jazmin

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Nueva Esperanza  se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Calderón del cantón Portoviejo, lugar de gente noble y trabajadora dedicada en su mayoría a las faenas del campo y el comercio.

En este lugar conocimos a Erika, tiene 22 años de edad, está soltera y vive en casa de sus padres. Está estudiando Psicología en una universidad de Portoviejo, Lleva tres ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la oportunidad de acceder a créditos a muy bajos intereses que les permiten seguir adelante con sus negocios.

Nuestra amiga es una jovencita muy luchadora que además de dedicarse a sus estudios también tiene su propio negocio, nos cuenta que en la ciudad de Portoviejo ella arrienda un local en el cual instalo un pequeño restaurante, pero que en su local solo vende alimentos nutritivos y naturales, nos cuenta que su clientela aumenta cada dia ya que son pocos los lugares donde se ofrece este tipo de alimentos pensando en la salud de los clientes, ella lleva 2 años con su negocio el cual crece dia a dia con el paso del tiempo.

Este crédito es para comprar víveres para preparar los alimentos.
 
Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios y ser una gran empresaria en lo que es venta de alimentos nutritivos ya que le encanta lo que hace.
texts.en:
The 'Nueva Esperanza' (New Hope) community bank meets every two weeks in Calderón parish, in Portoviejo canton.  This is an area of honest, hard-working people who mainly work in farming and commerce.

This is also where we get to know Erika.  Erika is 22 years old, single and lives in her parents' home.  She is studying for a degree in psychology at a university in Portoviejo.  She has been a member of her community bank for three loan cycles and she likes it because of the opportunity she has to access loans at very low interest rates.  This allows her to make progress in her business.

Our friend is an extremely tenacious young lady who, in addition to devoting herself to her studies, also runs her own business.  She tells us that she rents premises in the city of Portoviejo and set up a small restaurant there. In her restaurant she only sells nutritious, natural food products.  She tells us that her customer base is growing every day as there are few places that offer this type of food, thinking of their customers' health.  She has been in this business for two years and it grows day by day.

Erika will use this loan to buy supplies with which to prepare her food.

Her dreams are to finish her studies and become a great businesswoman in her field, selling nutritious food, as she loves what she does.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making food

loans.name: Hamza

texts.en:
Hamza is a very caring father. He tries to provide his family with all modern conveniences. As he is very industrious, gentle and good-natured, his family loves him very much. Twenty-one years ago he organized his own business. He is engaging in cattle husbandry also he grows agricultural products such as potatoes.  

Hamza is helped by his lovely wife. They try to develop their business to better their standard of living. They have a child who loves his parents very much. Hamza wants to develop his business further and that’s why he is asking for a loan to buy seeds for the new season. He waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy seeds.

loans.name: Jose Alberto

texts.es: José Alberto de  52 años de edad de la localidad de Chinandega, obrero, con tres hijos mayores de edad, está solicitando el financiamiento para hacerle mejoras a su casa de habitación  que consisten en levantar la pared donde existe una puerta y levantar pared en un costado muro perimetral de la vivienda, ya que desde que adquirió la casa ha querido hacerle mejoras pero por falta de dinero no lo había podido realizar, sus sueños y metas es terminar de mejorar su casa. el financiamiento lo quiere para comprar material de construcción como: bloques,  cemento, arena, piedrín, hierro, alambre, clavos. Entre otros.
texts.en: José Alberto is 52 years old and from Chinandega.  He is a manual worker and has three adult children.  He is requesting this loan to make some improvements to his home.  He would like to put up a wall where there is currently a door and build a perimeter wall at the side of the house.  Since he acquired his house he has wanted to make improvements to it but, owing to a lack of money, he has not been able to.  His dreams and goals are to finish improving his home.  He would like this loan to buy building supplies such as blocks, cement, sand, gravel, iron, wire, nails, etc.

loans.use: to buy blocks, cement, sand, grave, iron, wire, nails, etc.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario tiene 38 años de edad, vive al lado de su esposo quien es su mano derecha y quien es su apoyo y sobre todo su mejor amigo, quien trabaja en su pequeño negocio de peluquería, juntos tiene 3 hijos cuyas edades comprenden 14, 4 y 1 añito, para Rosario sus hijos son la mayor bendición y regalo que Dios le ha dado y por quienes da la vida y se esfuerza mucho por darle una vida digna y sobre todo un buen ejemplo de trabajo y humildad. Su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Nazca, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener, ciudad un clima caluroso y es una ciudad en la cual se pueden visitar muchos atractivos turísticos como las Líneas de Nazca, las pirámides de Cahuachi, el cementerio de Chauchilla, los acueductos de Cantalloc, entre otros, en los cuales podemos admirar lo grandioso de la cultura Nazca y en los que podemos despejarnos.  Cuando Rosario tiene un tiempito libre le gusta mucho ver televisión en especial sus novelas favoritas, también en ocasiones aprovecha la oportunidad para poder cocinar uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con pollo”. Con el apoyo de sus padres ella logro estudiar la carrera de Turismo pero no pudo encontrar trabajo.

Con mucho entusiasmo Rosario trabaja en su negocio de venta de abarrotes, ella trabaja alrededor de 12 horas y pueda atender hasta 20 clientes en el día, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque ofrece productos de calidad a precios cómodos para los clientes.

Rosario está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su gran ayuda ella podrá comprar  mercadería para su negocio como cerveza, huevos, gaseosas, arroz al por mayor, azúcar, entre otros, lo que le permitirá tener mayor variedad de productos para poder ofrecer a sus clientes y así mejorar sus ingresos y seguir creciendo y luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Construir su vivienda y darle una buena educación a sus hijos”.
texts.en: Rosario is 38 years old and lives together with her husband who is her right-hand man, her source of support and, above all, her best friend. He works in a small hairdressing business. The couple have three children who are 14 years, 4 years and 1 year old. Rosario's children are the biggest blessing and gift that God has given her. She works hard in order to offer them a decent life. Above all, she wants to be a good example of hard work and humility. Her home is located in the city of Nazca. This city is known for its hot climate. It is also a city with a lot of tourist attractions such as the Nazca lines, the Cahuachi pyramids, the Chauchilla cemetery and the Cantalloc aqueducts. These places allow us to admire the grandeur of the Nazca culture and clear our heads. Whenever Rosario has any free time, she really enjoys watching television, especially her favorite soap operas. She also occasionally takes the opportunity to cook one of her favorite dishes, the delicious 'chicken and rice'. With the support of her parents, Rosario managed to study for a degree in tourism but she was not able to find work. Rosario works with a lot of enthusiasm in her business selling groceries. She works around 12 hours a day and can serve up to 20 customers. She believes that her business is doing well because she is very friendly with her customers and, above all, she offers good-quality products at prices that are affordable for her customers. Rosario is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their helps, she will be able to buy merchandise for her business such as beer, eggs, soda, rice in bulk, sugar, etc. This will allow her to have a wider variety of products to offer her customers and she will therefore improve her income and continue growing her business and working hard so that she can fulfill her biggest dream: to build her own home and provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (beer, eggs, soda, rice in bulk, sugar, etc.)

loans.name: Alejandro Carlos

texts.es:
Alejandro es un hombre de 28 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago con su pareja y sus 2 pequeños hijos de 6 y 2 años de edad, él es una persona muy alegre, entusiasta y trabajador, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos junto con su esposa para sacar adelante a su familia; gracias al apoyo de sus padres, Alejandro pudo estudiar la carrera técnica de mecánica automotriz; en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y vecinos, y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos riquísimos Tallarines Verdes para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia y gracias al apoyo de su pareja, Alejandro puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de lavado de autos, él trabaja un aproximado de 10 horas diarias y puede atender un promedio de 15 clientes; adicionalmente Alejandro cuenta con un auto propio el cual alquila a otros choferes para que lo trabajen, él cree que su negocio marcha bien debido a su buen servicio y al trato amable y respetuoso que brinda a sus clientes.
Alejandro se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de accesorios para su auto, tales como: espejos, faroles, llantas, entre otros;  de esta manera Alejandro podrá tener su auto en mejores condiciones para seguir alquilándolo y con esos ingresos adicionales espera poder ahorrar el dinero necesario para comprar un local propio para tener su negocio lavado de autos y un taller de mecánica, para con ello poder asegurar el futuro y bienestar de sus pequeños hijos.
texts.en:
Alejandro is a 28-year-old man who lives in the city of Ica, in Santiago district, with his partner and young children who are 6 and 2 years old.  He is a very cheerful, enthusiastic and hard-working person who, together with his wife, puts all his efforts into providing for their family.  Thanks to his parents' support, Alejandro was able to study for a technical degree in auto mechanics.  In his free time, he enjoys playing soccer with his friends and neighbors.  He also sometimes cooks delicious 'tallarines verdes' (green pesto noodles) to share with his family.

Through his own initiative and with his partner's support, Alejandro set up a small car wash business.  He works approximately 10 hours a day and can serve an average of 15 customers.  In addition, he also has his own care which he hires out to other drivers to work in.  He believes that his business is doing well owing to the good service he provides and the kind, respectful way he treats his customers.

Alejandro is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, he will be able to buy accessories for his car such as mirrors, headlamps, tires, etc.  This will allow him to keep the car in better condition so that he can continue hiring it out.  With this additional income, he hopes to be able to save up the money he needs to buy his own premises so that he can have an auto repair shop alongside his car wash business.  This will enable him to guarantee he young children's future and well-being.

loans.use: to buy accessories for his car such as mirrors, headlamps, tires, etc.

loans.name: Ernesto Manuel

texts.es:
Ernesto es un joven de 29 años de edad, el cual vive al lado de su esposa quien lo apoya mucho y juntos tienen 2 hijos los cuales va a la escuela primaria, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad e imperial, caracterizada por su clima variado, su agricultura, en especial el cultivo de algodón, maíz, entre otros. Ernesto es muy trabajador pero hace unos años ocurrió un terremoto, en el que perdió su vivienda y a pesar de ese problema supo salir adelante, poco a poco fue ahorrando dinero y lograron comprar 2 computadores con las cuales iniciaron su pequeño negocio de cabinas de internet, impresiones, tipeos y escaneos, el cual ya lleva 4 años y con el cual Ernesto puede solventar los gastos de hogar, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque  es muy responsable y trabajador y sobre todo atiende a sus clientes de manera muy amable.

Ernesto está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que  gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado los prestatarios Kiva el podrá comprar canaletas, cables de electricidad, tomacorrientes, módulos para colocar computadoras, entre otros, ya que Ernesto abrirá otro pequeño local de internet, así el podrá realizar una adecuada instalación de su nueva cabina y seguir creciendo en su negocio y sobre todo mejorar sus ingresos, de esa manera seguir trabajando y luchando para realizar su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a sus hijos y sobre todo tener una cadena de cabinas de internet”.
texts.en:
Ernesto is a young man of 29.  He lives alongside his wife, who is a great support, and their two children who attend elementary school.  Their home is located in the city of Imperial which is noted for its varied climate and its agriculture, especially its cotton and corn growing.  Ernesto is a very hard-working man but some years ago there was an earthquake and he lost his home.  In spite of this problem, however, he knew how to move forward.  He gradually saved money and managed to buy two computers with which he started his small business offering Internet access, printing, typing and scanning services.  He has been in this business for four years now and is able to cover his household expenses.  Ernesto believes that his business is doing well because he is very responsible, hard-working and, above all, he serves his customers in a very friendly manner.

Ernesto is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, he will be able to buy cable conduits, electricity cables, power outlets, units in which to install computers, etc.  Ernesto will open another small Internet cafe.  With this loan, he will be able to carry out suitable installation of his new premises, continue to grow his business and, above all, improve his income.  In this way, he will be able to continue working hard to fulfill his biggest dream: to provide his children with a good education and, above all, to own a chain of Internet cafes.

loans.use: to buy cable conduits, electricity cables, power outlets, units in which to install computers, etc.

loans.name: Duo Luz Del Sol Group

texts.es: Duo Luz del Sol.este duo esta integrado por la señora Ana Elizabeth,ella tiene 33 años de edad es soltera,ella se dedica a la venta de ropa tipica inicio su negocio hace varios años,sus ventas las realiza de forma ambulante,nos cuenta que el sueño de ella es poder tener un local donde vender su producto, y para eos tiene que aumentar su capital para poder cumplir su sueño,es por eso que esta solicitando este credito para la compra de ropa tipica, ella espera que le puedan ayudar con le credito solicitado.
texts.en: One of the members of this two-person group is Ana Elizabeth.  She is 33 years old, single and has been selling traditional clothing for some years.  She makes her sales as an itinerant street vendor.  She tells us that her dream is to have premises where she can sell her products.  In order to fulfill this dream, she must increase her capital.  She is requesting this loan to buy traditional clothing.  She hopes that you can help her with the loan she is requesting.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothing to sell

loans.name: Duo Libano Group

texts.es: Duo Libano,este duo esta integrado por la señora thelma ella tiene 33 años de edad, doña Thelma cuenta con una tienda de productos comestibles de primera nececidad,ella vende en su tienda(Jabon,fideos,azucar,arroz,etc)nos cuenta que gracias a Dios a podido mantener su tienda, ahora ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas bariedad en productos comestibles, ella espera que le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado ya que su mayor anelo es agrandar mas su tinda.
texts.en: One of the members of this two-person group is 33-year-old Thelma.  Thelma has a grocery store where she sells soap, noodles, sugar, rice, etc.  She tells us that, thanks to God, she has managed to keep her store running.  She is now requesting a loan to buy a wider variety of food products.  She hopes that you can help her with this loan.  Her greatest wish is to further expand her store.

loans.use: to buy basic household products

loans.name: Martin

texts.es: Martin es casado y con tres hijos, trabaja como guardia de seguridad y su esposa como empleada domestica, personas serias, responsables y sobre todo trabajadoras; necesitan se les apoye para pagar por la instalación del portón de su casa ya que por la inseguridad que esta rebasando los limites de las autoridades en la ciudad, quieren tener mejor protegida a su familia.
texts.en: Martin is married and has three children.  He works as a security guard and his wife works as a domestic employee.  They are serious, responsible, hard-working people.  They need support to pay for the installation of a front door in their home.  Owing to the level of crime which is exceeding the limits of the authorities in the city, they would like to better protect their family.

loans.use: to pay workmen to install a front door

loans.name: Duo Chajalajya Group
