Lucie Béatrice is a 41-year-old woman who is unmarried and a mother of two children, 12 and 16 years old, who still go to school. Lucie Béatrice has been managing a bar in a district in the capital for five years where she sells hygienic drinks. Over the course of time, she acquired experience in this domain enabling her to earn a considerable customer base. 

Unfortunately, the slight size of her inventory prevents her from suitably meeting the demands of her customer base, which in turn has shrunk significantly. As a result, her sales have dropped, and so has her profits. 

She is therefore requesting this loan to buy more cases of drinks, and this will enable her to retain more customers, earn other customers, and especially to increase her sales and profits. This will not only enable her to expand and fix up her building, it will meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy cases of beverages

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a 21-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. She has a three-year-old child.

Arlene has been in the business of raising hogs for three years now. In addition, she is active in a rice-farming business. She plans to use her loan to buy feed for her hogs and pay for the operational costs of her rice field. Each month, they earn a certain amount from their hog-raising and rice-farming business.

In the future, Arlene would like to buy more piglets and start a larger scale hog-raising business. She wants to build a piggery and improve their farm to gain more yield. She is optimistic that through this, she will be able to give her daughter a better future and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To buy feed for her hogs and pay for the operational costs of her rice field

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry is 45 years old and lives in Katipa, Lopez Jaena. She is married with five children.
 
Jerry works in the fish industry and sells/catches fish for a living. She has been doing this for a while. She has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to pay for fishing materials, gasoline, and maintenance.
 
Jerry has been a member of PMPC for 10 years. In the future, Jerry hopes to have enough savings for her family.

loans.use: To pay for fishing materials, gasoline, and maintenance

loans.name: Monalisa

texts.en: Monalisa is from Macupa, Tangub City. She is 34 years old. Monalisa is married and has three children. Monalisa used her last loan to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Her business has grown and has become successful. Now, she's taking out a new loan to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next cropping. She hopes to be able to grow her business even more.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next cropping

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 26 years old. He is single and works as a mechanic in Nyahururu. He repairs motorcycles and also sells spare parts for both motorcycles and bicycles.

Having paid his first loan well and in good time, he will be taking out his second loan. He plans to use the loan to buy more motorcycle spare parts. This will also enable him to meet his customers' demands and needs.

In the future, Richard hopes to grow his business, open a big spare parts retail shop, and make more income.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts for repair work

loans.name: Maria Jesus

texts.es:
Doña María de 28 años de edad, es casada ella vive en la ciudad de San Lorenzo y tiene 2 hijos y vive junto con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su propia casa de habitación de esta ciudad en el departamento de Valle al Sur de Honduras.
Doña María se dedica a la venta de  golosinas, Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora que hace varios años tiene actividad comercial,  su negocio es la venta de frutas como la sandia y el melón como también Golosinas en el que vende tacos, enchiladas, tortillas con quesillo, yuca con chicharrón, tajadas, pollo frito, refrescos naturales, refrescos de botella, agua, entre otro  tipo de golosinas .Este negocios es muy bueno ya que la demanda de los clientes cada día es mayor ya que en el se encuentra todo tipo de Golosinas y refrescos.
Doña María esta solicitando un préstamo de 4,000 lempiras para la compra de mas carrnes, verduras, manteca, etc. Con el apoyo de este crédito ella podrá trabajar más en su negocio porque su inventario será más grande y las ventas indudablemente mejoraran porque habrá más producto que ofrecer a los clientes. El sueño de doña María es  tener mayor clientela para poder vender más y así  con las utilidades poder realizar algunas mejoras a su vivienda.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Junio 2012
texts.en:
María, age 28, is married and lives in the city of San Lorenzo.  She has two children, and she lives with her husband and two children in her own house.  The house is in this city in the Valle department in the south of Honduras.

María sells snacks.  She is a very enterprising woman, who has had a business activity for several years.  Her business is selling fruit like watermelon and other melons.  She also sells snacks, tacos enchiladas, tortillas with farmer’s cheese, yucca with “chicharrón” [fried pork rinds], fried plantains, fried chicken, natural soft drinks, bottled soft drinks, water, and other types of snacks.

This business is very good because the customer demand is bigger every day.  You can find all types of snacks and soft drinks in her business.

María is requesting a loan for 4,000 lempiras to buy more meat, vegetables, and shortening, etc.  With the support of this loan she will be able to work more in her business because her inventory will be bigger.  Sales will undoubtedly improve because there will be more products to offer her customers.

María’s dream is to have more customers in order to be able to sell more.  That way she will be able to use the profits to make some improvements to her home.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – June 2112

loans.use: to buy more meat, vegetables, shortening, and other products for her business.

loans.name: Hippolyte

texts.fr: Hippolyte est un jeune homme de 27 ans, célibataire,sans enfant.Il est un éleveur de poulets dans une banlieue depuis 04 ans déjà.Il achète des oeufs de poulets qu'il incube jusqu'à éclosion et élève les jeunes poussins jusqu'à maturité pour les revendre.Sa qualité d'ambitieux lui a permis de se lancer à fonds dans son activité, d'où l'augmentation considérable de son effectif de poussins en peu d’années.Effectif qu'il a du mal à gérer  vu la petitesse de son capital qui l'empêche de s'approvisionner convenablement en aliments pour ses poulets ce qui crée à la longue une diminution considérable de ceux-ci.Il voudrait alors ce crédit pour pouvoir acheter des  sacs de provende,maïs,soja, qui lui permettront de bien nourrir ses poussins afin de pouvoir mieux les vendre pendant les fêtes ce qui augmentera par conséquent son bénéfice.Bénéfice qui lui permettra  d'une part d'agrandir et d'étendre son activité dans le but de devenir un grand éleveur et d'autre part de subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens.
texts.en:
Hippolyte is a young man, 27 years old, who is unmarried and without children. He has been a poultry farmer in a suburb for four years already. He buys chicken eggs which he incubates until they hatch. He raises the young chicks until maturity and then resells them. His ambitious character enabled him to put his all into starting this business, resulting in a considerable increase in the number of chicks in not many years. 

But these numbers have been difficult for him to manage given his slight capital preventing him from stocking up appropriately on feed for his hens, which have shrunk significantly in number over time. 

He would therefore like this loan to buy sacks of "provende", corn, and soybeans enabling him to feed his chicks well, better allowing him to sell them over the holidays, and thus increasing his profits. The profits will enable him not only to grow and extend his business with the goal of becoming a major poultry farmer but also to support himself day to day.

loans.use: to buy sacks of corn and soybeans

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Замире 44 года, имеет 4 детей. Замира работает поваром в местной больнице с занятостью до 2 часов дня, и в качестве дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, на протяжении 13 лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес практически с нуля. Благодаря упорному труду Замиры,  в хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  2 коровы и теленок, 8 голов мелкого рогатого скота. Прибыль от хозяйства составляет примерно 12,000 сом в месяц. Прошедшая зима была очень холодной и долгой, что привело к падежу скота и серьезному удорожанию кормов, поэтому Замира решила осуществить закуп кормов и сена, сделав запас во избежание рисков подорожания в сезон. С этой целью, Замира обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS).  Доходы от кредита Замира будет вкладывать в оплату обучения для старшего сына, а в дальнейшем - в развитие бизнеса.
texts.en: Zamira is 44 years old, and has four children. She is employed as a cook in the local hospital, where she works until 2 pm. As a second source of income for her family, she has been working in animal husbandry for 13 years — she started this business with practically nothing. Thanks to Zamira's hard work, her business now has 2 cows, a calf, and 8 sheep and goats. Monthly profits from the business are about 12,000 soms (KGS). Last winter was very cold and long, which resulted in livetock losses and a large increase in the cost of feed. So Zamira has decided to make a purchase a load of feed and hay, establishing a reserve as insurance against the risk of seasonal price increases. With this goal, Zamira has come to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan in the amount of 135,000 soms (KGS). Zamira will invest the income from the loan into paying for her older son's education, and subsequently, into developing her business.

loans.use: to purchase forage

loans.name: Haby

texts.fr: Madame Haby est une femme mariée qui habite au Sénégal. Elle évolue dans le secteur du commerce depuis 7 ans et pratique la vente de poissons dans la localité ou elle vit. Elle est membre d’un guichet de l’U-IMCEC et sollicite un crédit de 50000 frs prévu pour l’achat de plus de produits a vendre.  Elle souhaite accroitre ses bénéfices  pour mieux prendre en charge certains de ses besoins. Son projet futur est d’acquérir un marché plus élargi de ses produits  et une  grande place ou elle pourra commercialiser le poisson au niveau du marché de la localité ou elle exerce son activité.
texts.en:
Ms. Haby is a married woman who lives in Senegal. She has been working in the commercial sector for seven years and sells fish in the town where she lives. 

She is a member of a U-IMCEC branch and is requesting a loan of 50,000 francs for buying more goods to sell. She would like to increase her profits  to meet certain of her needs better. 

Her future plan is to acquire a wider market for her goods and a big spot where she will be able to sell the fish at her town's market, where she operates.

loans.use: to buy fish to resell

loans.name: Norma Estanislada

texts.es: La señora Norma Estanislada de 65 años de edad, casada con tres hijos mayores de edad, tiene por actividad económica una farmacia de medicinas naturales ubicada en su casa de habitación experiencia 16 años, para Norma este es su primer crédito con león 2000. El préstamo lo está solicitando para la compra de medicinas naturales como pastillas, jarabes, hierbas y pomadas.
texts.en:
Norma Estanislada, age 65, is married and has three grown children.  Her business activity is a natural medicine pharmacy, which is located in her house.  She has 16 years of experience.

This is Norma’s first loan with León 2000.  She is requesting the loan to buy natural medicines like pills, syrups, herbs, and ointments.

loans.use: to buy natural medicines like pills, syrups, herbs, and ointments.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 56 years old and lives in Nacional, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children. 

Leonila has a general store that sells groceries and other consumable products. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to be used to purchase additional stock for her general store.

Leonila has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Leonila hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her general store

loans.name: Yeni Maria

texts.es: Yeny María, de 34 años de edad, casada con tres hijo menores de edad, tiene por profesión abogado, está solicitando  financiamiento para hacerle mejoras a su casa de habitación como es hacer una pieza mas ya que la familia está creciendo y por falta de capital no las había hecho, en la actualidad está solicitando el financiamiento para la compra de material  de construcción como: bloques, cemento, hierro, zinc, perlines, clavos, alambre de amarre, piedrín, entre otros.
texts.en: Yeny Maria is 34 years old, she is married, she has three dependent children, and she is a lawyer.  She is seeking a loan so that she can make improvements to her home as it is not in a condition to support her growing family.  Because she lacks capital, improvements have not been made.  She is now seeking a loan so that she can buy the needed construction supplies such as bricks, cement, iron, zinc, beams, nails, tie wire, gravel, and other supplies.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, iron, zinc, beams, nails, tie wire, gravel, and other supplies.

loans.name: Kassim

texts.en:
Kassim is 29 years of age and married to Mawia, and they have two children aged three years and eight months old. He sells household utensils in Nakuru town and has been in the business for the past three years. It has been profitable. 

He paid all his previous loan amount well and in good time and this will be his second loan. He plans to use the amount to buy more utensils to sell in his business.

In the future, Kassim hopes to open a permanent shop in town and sell more household products, therefore he can make more income so as to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy more utensils for sale.

loans.name: Maria Elba

texts.es:
Doña Elba de 65 años de edad, es casada ella vive en la ciudad de San Lorenzo y tiene 5 hijos y vive junto con su esposo y sus hijos en su propia casa de habitación de esta ciudad en el departamento de Valle al Sur de Honduras.
Doña Elba se dedica a la venta de  Ladrillos y bloques.  Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora que hace varios años se dedica a esta actividad comercial, su negocio es la venta de ladrillos y bloques. Este negocios es muy bueno ya que la demanda de los clientes cada día es mayor ya que en el se encuentra calidad en su producto.
Doña Elba esta solicitando un préstamo de 4,000 lempiras para la compra de arena y cemento. Con el apoyo de este crédito ella podrá trabajar más en su negocio porque su inventario será más grande y las ventas indudablemente mejoraran porque habrá más producto que ofrecer a los clientes.
El sueño de doña Elba es  tener mayor clientela para poder vender más y así  con las utilidades poder realizar algunas mejoras a su vivienda.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Junio 2012
texts.en:
Elba is 65 years old, she is married, and she lives in the city of San Lorenzo.  She has 5 children and lives with her husband and their children in their own home in this city, in the department of Valle al Sur in Honduras.

Elba sells bricks and blocks.  She is an entrepreneurial woman who has done this work for many years.  Her business is the sale of bricks and blocks.  This is a good business because her customers demand more of her products every day and they always find high quality when they buy from her.

Elba is seeking a loan of 4,000 lempiras so that she can buy sand and cement.  With the money from this loan she will be able to work more at her job because she will invest the money and grow her business.  Her sales will undoubtedly grow because she will have more products to offer her customers.

Her dream is to have more customers so that she can sell more and with the income she earns she will be able to make some home improvements.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - June, 2012

loans.use: to buy cement and sand for her business.

loans.name: Gnosihewa Group

texts.fr: Groupe solidaire de sept personnes, l’Association GNOSIHEWA a pour Président Batime. Âgé de 60 ans, Batime est marié à une ménagère et est père de famille de sept enfants dont quatre sont encore sur les bancs de l’école. Batime exerce comme métier de cultivateur  depuis les années 1983. Son activité se porte principalement sur la culture du maïs ce qui se déroule à Pagala Gare plus précisément dans la localité d’Ataka où il est épaulé par trois membres de sa famille et quatre employés. Batime est à son premier crédit à WAGES  qui est destiné à l’achat des outils de travail. Comme perspectives d’avenir pour l’activité  et la famille, il espère respectivement augmenter sa superficie cultivable et construire un bâtiment en dur pour sa famille. Les autres membres du groupe exercent comme activité la culture du maïs également.
texts.en: The Gnoshihewa solidarity group has seven members. Its Chhair is Batima. Batima’s wife is a homemaker. They have seven children, four of whom are still in school. Batima has been working as a farmer since about 1983. He mainly grows corn. His farm is in Pagala Gare, more specifically in the area of Ataka. Three family members and four employees help him on the farm. Batime is on his firs WAGEs loan. The loan is meant for purchasing work tools. As to future perspectives on his work and family love, he hopes to increase his cultivated land and build a durable house for his family. The other group members also grow corn.

loans.use: to buy work tools.

loans.name: Sirila Argentina

texts.es: La señora Sirila Argentina es soltera vive con sus padres y sobrinos, Tiene experiencia en el sector del comercio, como es una fritanga donde ofrece gallo pinto, pollo, carne asada, enchiladas, maduro, tacos, muelitas, tajadas,  inicio su negocio desde hace 3 años, con las ganancia le ayuda a sus padres y sobrinos, ya que ella no pudo tener hijos, el financiamiento lo necesita para la compra de los ingredientes de su material de trabajo como es: plátanos, salsas, carne, pollo, arroz, frijoles entre otros.
texts.en:
Sirila Argentina is single, and she lives with her parents and her nieces and nephews.  She has business experience; she has a small restaurant where she sells rice and beans, chicken, grilled meat, enchiladas, ripe plantains, tacos, crab claws, and fried plantains.  She started her business three years ago.  

She uses her income to help her parents and her nieces and nephews because she was not able to have children.

She needs the loan to buy ingredients to do her work.  She will buy things like bananas, salsas, meat, chicken, and beans, among others.

loans.use: bananas, salsas, meat, chicken, and beans, among others.

loans.name: Mary Cruz

texts.es: Mary Cruz, casada de 34 años de edad,  con dos hijos menores de edad por el cual tiene que mantener, tiene por actividad económica  una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación, inicio con esta herramienta hace 5 años por la necesidad que tenia de tener un ingresos para su familia, Mary Cruz se siente muy agradecida porque gracias a fundación 2000 a podido hacer más grande su negocio. El financiamiento lo está solicitando para invertir en productos de consumo diario como: arroz, azúcar, pan, leche de vaca, leche de bolsas, jugos naturales, gaseosas,  caramelos, churritos, entre otros.
texts.en: Mary Cruz is married and she is 34 years old.  She has two dependent children that she cares for.  She supports her family with a small store that is located in her home.  She began this business 5 years ago because of the need to generate an income for her family.  Mary Cruz is thankful because thanks to Fundación León 2000, she was able to grow her business.  This loan that she is seeking is so that she can invest in daily consumable products such as rice, sugar, bread, cow's milk, natural juices, soft drinks, candy, churritos, and other supplies.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, bread, cow's milk, natural juices, soft drinks, candy, churritos, and other supplies.

loans.name: Ibrahim Deidan

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 50-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has 4 children between the ages of 5 and 20 years old. All of his children go to school. 

Ibrahim  runs a general store and has been in business for 5 years. He has no employees. Ibrahim heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. He is taking a loan of 800 SDG to purchase soap, sugar, rice, and many other items. In addition to this business, he has no other source of income.

In 5 years, Ibrahim would like to open many branches and employ others. His major challenges include high prices in the market. 

Ibrahim says he is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy items like soap, sugar, rice, etc.

loans.name: Ana Fabiola

texts.es: La Sra. Ana tiene 22 años tiene un hijo de la edad de 1 años, ella se dedica al servicio de internet en su café internet que tiene en la zona de Villa Israel de la ciudad de Cochabamba este préstamo es su tercera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Ana va a usar este préstamo para la compra de dos computadoras para juegos en red, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para la compra de estos equipos, la Sra. Ana enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que por la zona existen varios café internet, pero ella no se puede quejar ya que tiene clientela y utilizara los beneficios en la compra de mas equipos de computación para equipar mas su negocio, la Sra. Ana es una persona joven y muy trabajadora esta es la única actividad con la que mantiene a su familia se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en: Ana is 22 years old. She has a child who is 1 year old. She works providing Internet services in her Internet café, which she operates in the Villa Israel area of the city of Cochabamba. This loan is her third sequence within the institution. Ana will use this loan to buy two computers for online games. Her reason for requesting this loan is that she does not have sufficient funds to buy these computers. Ana faces challenges in her business such as the competition, because there are several Internet cafés in the area. However, she cannot complain, since she has customers. She will use the benefits to buy more computer units to equip her business better. Ana is a young and very hard-working person. This is the only work she has to maintain her family. She is happy and grateful about the opportunity provided to her.

loans.use: to buy two computers.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. Marietta earns more income from a general store, pig fattening, and direct selling of MSE and Avon products.

She is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell in her food vending business.

Marietta has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Reem

texts.en:
Reem is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo. He is pictured in his restaurant.

Reem is a 24-year-old young woman. She is married and a mother to two sons and one daughter.

For the past 3 years, Reem's husband has been operating a restaurant selling fast food and sandwiches. The business has been a profitable project, but does not yet bring in enough money to cover the family's expenses and cover the costs of work.

Reem is requesting a youth loan of 1,000 USD from FATEN to help her husband cover the costs of purchasing a collection of meat and vegetables and a new refrigerator, which he will use for preserving food at his restaurant. This will allow Reem's husband to expand the scope of his work, improve his business, and increase the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase a collection of meat and vegetables and a new refrigerator for preserving food at the restaurant.

loans.name: Juana Paula

texts.es: Juana Paula, casada de 57  años de edad,  con un hijo mayor de edad, tiene por actividad económica  una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación , esta emprendedora inicio con esta herramienta desde hace 28 años por la necesidad que tenia de tener un ingresos para su familia, en la actualidad sigue luchado por el pan de cada día junto a su negocio el cual le ha sido rentable por mucho años, el financiamiento lo está solicitando para invertir en productos de consumo diario como:  frijoles, azúcar, pan, leche de vaca, leche de bolsas, jugos naturales, gaseosas,  caramelos, churritos, entre otros.
texts.en:
Juana Paula, age 57, is married and has an adult son.  Her business activity is a grocery store, which is located in her house.  This entrepreneur started with this means of earning income 28 years ago.  She started because she needed income for her family.

She now continues struggling for her daily bread in her business, which has been profitable for many years.

The loan she is requesting is to buy daily consumption products like beans, sugar, bread, cow’s milk, milk in pouches, natural juices, soft drinks, sweets, and  “churritos” [crunchy snack sticks], among others.

loans.use: to buy beans, sugar, bread, cow’s milk, milk in pouches, natural juices, soft drinks, sweets, and  “churritos” [crunchy snack sticks], among others.

loans.name: Carmen Maria

texts.es:
La señora Carmen María de 34 años de edad, casada, del domicilio de león, esta emprendedora se dedica a dos negocios como es  la costura, y venta de accesorios de celulares, chip, carcasa y varios modelos de celulares en un kiosco ubicado en su casa de habitación experiencia desde hace varios años
El financiamiento lo quiere para invertir en la compra de telas variadas, y accesorios de celulares
texts.en:
Carmen María is 34, married, and lives in León. 

This entrepreneur has two businesses: sewing, and selling cell phone accessories such as chips and cases, as well as several models of cell phone, at a stand located in her home. She has several years experience doing this.

She wants the loan in order to buy a variety of fabrics, as well as cell phone accessories.

loans.use: To buy a variety of fabrics, as well as cell phone accessories.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
As a married parent of 3 children, Mary Joy works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Mary Joy is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of vegetables to sell for her vegetable vending business.

Mary Joy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to  buy phones to sell.

loans.name: Pedro Isaac

texts.es:
Pedro es un hombre de 20 años, es soltero, vive con sus padres y hermanos en la ciudad de Ica, a pesar de su corta edad Pedro es un joven trabajador y entusiasta que tiene un gran deseo de superación y muchas ganas de ayudar a sus padres, ya que desea agradecerles por los cuidados y apoyo brindados; en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y vecinos y en algunas oportunidades cocina un riquísimo Lomo Saltado para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño, entusiasmo y con el apoyo de sus padres, Pedro se encuentra estudiando la carrera técnica de Administración de Empresas, gracias a ello y a su esfuerzo él trabaja como auxiliar en una empresa agrícola de su ciudad, Pedro se siente a gusto realizando su labora ya que lo consideran mucho por su buen desempeño y trato amable hacia los demás.
Pedro se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos para la tramitación de su matrícula, mensualidades y pago de certificados de estudios; de esta manera Pedro podrá mejorar su condición académica y reforzar sus conocimientos, para así poder desarrollarse como buen profesional y con ello espera poder obtener un buen trabajo con el cual pueda seguir apoyando a mejorar la calidad de vida de sus padres.
texts.en:
Pedro is 20 years old and single.  He lives with his parents and siblings in the city of Ica.  Despite his young age, Pedro is a hard-working and enthusiastic young man.  He has a great desire to succeed, and he is very eager to help his parents.  He wants to thank them for the care and support they have given him.

In his free time he likes to play soccer with his friends and neighbors.  Sometimes he cooks a delicious “Lomo Saltado” [Peruvian stir-fried beef] to share with his family.

With a lot of effort, enthusiasm, and support from his parents, Pedro is studying Business Administration.  Thanks to this and to his effort, he works as an assistant in an agricultural business in his city.  Pedro likes doing this work because they regard him highly for his good performance and the kind way he treats others.

Pedro is very grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to the help they have given him he will be able to cover the expenses for the registration process, monthly payments, and educational certificates.  This way Pedro will be able to improve himself academically and strengthen his knowledge in order to be able to develop himself as a good professional.  With that he hopes to be able to get a good job, which he will use to be able to continue supporting the improvement of his parents’ lives.

loans.use: to cover the expenses for the registration process, monthly payments, and  educational certificates.

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Ninfa is 63 years old and married with 6 children.

Ninfa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23000 loan through NWTF to buy products to sell.

Ninfa has borrowed and paid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Ninfa aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell

loans.name: Arcellie

texts.en:
Arcellie is 37 years old and married with 3 children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Arcellie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell.

Arcellie has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, canned goods, biscuits, eggs, etc.. 

In the future Arcellie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito is 45 years old, married with 4 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Charito has a fishing business in the Philippines. Charito requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fishing equipment.

Charito has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, Charito would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional fishing equipment

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
This is Mary Jane.  She previously obtained an 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase quantities of raw materials like fabric and thread and other materials needed in her business of making rugs. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal household expenses and in buying more quantities of raw materials.

She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan to buy additional supplies of raw materials needed in her business.  Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children.  She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Mary Jane hopes to grow her business in the coming years.  She dreams of giving her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet every week.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria works hard to support her family. Gloria is married and has a frozen foods business in the Philippines.

Gloria requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell.

Gloria has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Gloria would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks to sell in her frozen foods business

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is married, with three school-age children.  She is 46 years old and lives in Calunasan, Larena, Siquijor.  Laura is a farmer and operates a backyard piggery business as the major source of income of her family.  She has been doing this for two years.  She has requested a loan of PHP 9,000 to purchase feeds and medicines for her business.

Laura has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for more than a year.  In the future, Laura plans to deposit her savings for the brighter education of her children.

loans.use: To purchase feeds and medicines  for her piggery business

loans.name: Mency

texts.en:
Mency is married, with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  Mency is 37 years old, and three of her children are currently going to school.

Mency has a manicure/pedicure business in the Philippines. Mency requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase supplies for her business.

Mency has been in this business for 10 years. In the future,  Mency would like to save enough for her three children in college to complete their studies.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for her manicure/pedicure business

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice owns a retail shop in Nyahururu town and has been in the business for the past 12 years. She is 45 years old and a single mother of four children.

This will be her first loan.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy more stocks of rice, sugar, soap, and maize flour to sell in her retail shop.  With the anticipated income, she plans to expand her business by opening another retail shop.

In the future, Eunice hopes to buy a plot and build a house for her family, as well as improve their living standards.

loans.use: To buy more stock of sugar, rice, and soap for sale.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is 30 years old with three children who are in school.  She works very hard to provide for them.  Michelle runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for 10 years.   She sells a variety of items such as sugar, canned goods, egg, noodles, spices, etc.

Michelle  has requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock for her store.

In the future Michelle would like to save enough, to provide a secure financial stability of her family.

loans.use: buy additional stock to sell at her store.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 35 years old and lives in Polo Pitogo, Bato, Plaridel in Mis. Occidental, Philippines.  She is married with 4 children. 
To earn a living, Jenelyn has a business of selling native wine from a coconut tree. She earns about PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. Jenelyn has requested a loan of 20000 to hire labor, and purchase a gallon of native wine for sale .
Jenelyn has been a member of PMPC for 7 years.  In future, Jenelyn would like to succeed in her business.

loans.use: To hire labor, and purchase a gallon of native wine for sale

location.town: Plaridel-Polo Pitogo, Bato, Plaridel, Mis. Occ.

loans.name: Anecia

texts.en:
Anecia is 35 years old and married with 5 children.  She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines.  Anecia has been buying and selling piglets for 6 years and also earns additional income from vegetables & food vending.

Anecia is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy additional piglets, feed and vitamins for her pigs

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional piglets, feed and vitamins for her piglets

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita works hard to support her family.  She is widowed and has a fishing business in the Philippines.  Nenita has been in this business for 15 years.

Nenita requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing net and other materials for fishing.

In the future, Nenita would like to save money to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To buy fishing net and other materials for fishing

loans.name: Kholod

texts.en:
Kholod is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her son appears in her Kiva profile photo, pictured in the place where he sells vegetables.  

Kholod is a 41-year-old woman, she is married and a mother to one son and one daughter, her son is 21 years old, and her daughter is 15.
For the past ten years, Kholod's husband has been selling fruits and vegetables on a stall and now his son is helping him with sales.   It has been a profitable business, but needs more support to cover the family's needs. 

Kholod is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her husband and her son cover the costs of purchasing a new collection of fruits and vegetables and to improve the condition of the food stall. This will increase sales and improve the family's income and create better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables and to improve the condition of the food stall.

loans.name: Martha Del Socorro

texts.es: Cándida de 43 años de edad, casada, con tres hijos ya adultos totalmente independiente de ella, tiene por actividad económica la venta de mercadería en general ubicada en su casa de habitación,  inicio su negocio desde hace 17 años por la necesidad de obtener ingresos para el sustento de sus hijos. Ella está Solicitando el financiamiento para la compra de mercadería como: pantalones, short, camisetas, toallas, calcetines, zapatos, ropa interior, blusas de vestir y sport de mujer entre otras.
texts.en:
Cándida is 43, married, and has three children, who are now adults and totally independent of her.

She sells general merchandise from her home. She started her business 17 years ago because of the need to earn income for supporting her children.

She is applying for this loan in order to buy merchandise such as pants, shorts, T-shirts, towels, socks, shoes, underwear, women's dress and casual blouses, as well as other items.

loans.use: To buy pants, shorts, T-shirts, towels, socks, shoes, underwear, women's casual and dress blouses, as well as other items.

loans.name: Gs Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
El Señor Camilo tiene 43 años de edad tiene una 2 hijas, Su actividad principal es la venta de abarrotería (pulpería) desde hace más de 3 años, el cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa.
Don Camilo esta solicitando el apoyo para la compra de productos como ser: azúcar, manteca, jabón, refrescos, carnes, papel higiénico maíz, frijoles y otros productos de consumo para la buena atención de sus clientes, ya que al tener su negocio ubicado en la calle principal, y cerca de una iglesia, es muy visitado, con el apoyo solicitado del préstamo que reciba Don Camilo, le contribuirá a tener un mejor negocio, y así obtener mejores ingresos para cubrir los gastos en el hogar y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
Don Camilo sueña con tener el mejor negocio de la zona.
Rosalva se dedica al comercio, su actividad principal es la venta de ropa interior, cosméticos sandalias ropa nueva e incluso hasta ropa americana desde hace 4 años, ella tiene dos hijos, y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo en los gastos familiares.
Vicente se dedica a la carpintería desde hace 7 años,  el es una persona muy trabajadora y su negocio lo realiza en su casa de habitación, lugar donde tiene su mesa de trabajo y sus herramientas, también realiza trabajos de manera ambulante donde es muy reconocido en su comunidad por los trabajos que el realiza, los cuales son la elaboración de todo tipo de trabajo con madera.
Danli El Paraíso, Honduras - Junio 2012
texts.en:
Camilo is 43 years old and has 2 daughters. His principal activity for the last 3 years has been selling groceries in his general store. He can count on his wife's help.

Camilo is requesting assistance in buying products like sugar, lard, soap, soft drinks, meat, beans, toilet tissue and other consumer items which will attract his customers. Since his store is located on a principal street and near the church, it is much visited. With the help of this loan, Camilo will be able to develop a better business, obtaining a better income that will cover household expenses and offer a better quality of life for his family. Camilo dreams of having the best business in the zone.

Rosalva is also a merchant. Her principal activity for some 4 years now, has been selling underwear, cosmetics, sandals, and new clothing, including American clothes. She has 2 children and can count on her husband's help in covering family expenses.

Vicente has been a carpenter for the last 7 years. He is a hard-working person and his business is carried out in the house he lives in, where he has his work table and tools. He also solicits jobs on the streets, and is well known in his community for the projects he has done, which includes all types of work with wood.

loans.use: to buy sugar, lard, soap, soft drinks, meat, toilet paper, corn, beans, and other consumer products for a food market.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is a 29-year-old married woman. She has two children, and one is enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Suleiman Said, and he works as a tilly checker. 

Sofia operates a kiosk and sells her goods from home. She's worked in this business for one year.  Her primary customers are local residents.  Sofia's other source of income includes her spouse's contribution.  She describes her greatest business challenge to be fluctuations of prices, and her highest monthly expense is food. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Sofia will use the KES 50,000 loan to purchase fishing materials, e.g., ring nets.  Sofia aspires to open a wholesale business in the future.   She joined Yehu because of the variety of its credit products.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials, e.g., ring nets

loans.name: Cereza

texts.en:
Cereza is 47 years old and has seven children. Cereza is married and one of her children is in school.

Cereza is in the agricultural business farming bananas in the Philippines. Cereza requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Cereza has been farming bananas for five years now and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Cereza would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 39 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Cecilia is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy feed and medicines for her pigs.

Cecilia has been raising pigs for 10 years and earns additional income from vegetable vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for her pigs.

loans.name: Duo Mariposas De Santiago Group

texts.es:
Dúo Mariposas de San Bartolo
Este dúo está conformado por doña Mirna, ella tiene 36 años de edad tiene tres hijos dos niños y una niña que es la mayor de ellos , doña paty como es conocida por sus clientes ella se dedica a la venta de consumo diario como arroz, fideos , aguas gaseosas, golosinas, detergentes , papel higiénico. Y helados doña Mirna está solicitando el crédito pàra surtir en su tienda de consumo diario, su propósito es seguir creciendo su tienda ya que durante los nueve años que lleva funcionando en el transcurso del tiempo gracias a dios ha ido creciendo y su propósito es servir a sus clientes con todos los productos que ellos necesitan, además de ello  quiere implementar en su negocio de venta  de helados ya que ella vende en la calle principal de san Bartolo ya que los hace de pura fruta y ella dice que necesita de capital para invertir en chocolate y frutas su anhelo es poner otro congelador en su tienda ya que solo  tiene un congelador que lo utiliza en la tienda y su anhelo es lograr tener otro congelador,
texts.en: The group "Dúo Mariposas de San Bartolo" is comprised of  Mirna and Paty.  Mirna is 36 years old and has 3 children.  Her oldest is a girl, and the other two are boys.  Paty, as she is known by her customers, has a business selling consumer staples such as rice, noodles, bottled water, sweets, detergents, toilet paper and ice cream.  Mirna is requesting a loan to stock her store with more consumer products.  Her goal is to continue to grow her business, because thanks to God, it has been growing over the 9 years that she has been running it. Her goal is to serve her customers with all of the products that they need.  In addition to this, she wants to set up her business so that she can sell ice cream.  She sells on the main street of San Bartolo, and she makes her ice cream from pure fruit.  She says that she needs capital to invest in chocolate and fruit.  Her wish is to install another freezer in her store, because she only has one freezer that she is currently using, and she would like to have another one.

loans.use: to buy basic consumer goods

loans.name: Poni Leju

texts.en:
Poni Leju is a 29-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has three children between the ages of three and eight years old. All of them go to school. 

Poni runs a general store and has been in business for three years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She is taking a loan of 1,000 SDG to purchase tomatoes, onions and many other items  In addition to this business, she has no other source of income

In five years, Poni would like to expand her business. 

Her major challenges include inflation in the market.

Poni says she wants to increase her capital through the loans.

loans.use: to buy items like tomatoes, onions, etc

loans.name: Trendelina

texts.en:
Trendelina is married and has two children in their late twenties.  All her family lives in the hill and mountain terrain of the southeastern part of Albania,  where the land surfaces are characterized by roughness and strong relief.  While the main activity for the majority of the people is planting crops for animal and human consumption, other activities such as livestock and wholesale remain a good source of income for a minority.  However, it's very rare for people in this region to be in aqua farming, as Trendelina is.

About five years back, she requested loans from VisionFund Albania.  Upon receiving three of them, one at a time, she started to make plans on how to build the farm, including preparing the land, building the dripping system, cultivating the trout fish, and of course finding the right clientele. So far the business has been profitable, and her clientele has been growing.  Her major clients are the restaurants in the city.
 
This time Trendelina is applying for another loan to repair the fish cages and nets.  For this matter, she is seeking Kiva lenders’ appreciation.

loans.use: To repair the trout cages and nets on her fish farm

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en:
Ashraf is a 22-year-old young man.  He is employed and gets low a salary, which is not enough to cover his needs and wedding expenses.

Ashraf is engaged and prepared to get married soon.  He is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing bedroom furniture and living room seats. This will help Ashraf to purchase the necessary furniture to his house and enable him to prepare well for this occasion to enjoy living with his new wife.

Ashraf is photographed in his house.

loans.use: To pay for furniture as he plans his married life

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 54 years old and a mixed crop farmer. She is married to Richard who is also a mixed crop farmer.  They are blessed with three adult children. She has been in large-scale farming for the past ten years and has a monthly income of KES 10,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. Jane will use the loan to purchase seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. 

Her hopes and dreams are to venture into pig-rearing and own a pig farm in Embu and also to improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Munduwa

texts.en:
Munduwa is a 27-year-old business woman who lives in Juba. She is married and has two children, ages 3 and 5. Both of them go to school. 

Munduwa runs a general store and has been in business for three years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She is taking a loan of 1,000 SDG to purchase beans, onions, and many other items. 

In addition to this business, she has no other source of income. In five years, Munduwa would like to expand her business. 

Her major challenges include inflation in the market. Munduwa says she wants to increase her capital through the loans.

loans.use: to buy items like beans, onions, cowpeas, etc.

loans.name: Sanyain

texts.en:
Sanyain is a widower and a father of four children between two and 16 years old.

He has been in business for six years and generates a monthly income of 60,000 Kenyan shilling. The loan will be used to purchase beads and textiles for sale. The anticipated profits will be used to pay school fees for his children.

This is the fourth loan from KADET LTD and he has successfully repaid all the previous loans. His hopes and dreams are to have a happy family and to have a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase beads to sell

loans.name: Nove

texts.en:
Nove is 36 years old and has three children. Nove is married and all of her children are in school.

Nove is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Nove requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Nove has been raising pigs for 15 years now and has borrowed 22 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Nove would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 42 years old and has five children. Divina is married and four of her children are in school.

Divina is in the agricultural business raising livestock in the Philippines. Divina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more livestock to sell.

Divina has been raising livestock for two years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Divina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to sell

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a 43-year-old woman from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines and is married to a fisherman in their place. She and her husband have been in the fishing business for more than twenty years now. 

She is asking for a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy fishing nets and for the maintenance of their fishing equipment. This will help in improving the quantity of their daily catch, thus increasing their possibility of a bigger income. 

Cristina works hard to support her husband and their seven children who are still dependent on them. 

In the near future, Cristina aims to improve their fishing business so that they will be able to increase their yield. With the income, she and her husband will be able to send their younger children to school. Some of it will be used to sustain and meet their daily needs and for savings purposes.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 28 years old, from Nakuru, and married with two children, who are aged three to six years old.

Samuel has a motorbike business that he has operated for the past six years.  He has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy spare parts for his motorbike.

He hopes to buy a van in the future and grow his transport business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his motorbike.

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es: Gloria vive en el sector norte de Guayaquil conocido como las Orquídeas, tiene 43 años y se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y ropa por catálogos. Tiene 2 años dedicándose a ese negocio el cual lo empezó por la necesidad ya que es madre soltera de 3 niños. Maneja el negocio ella sola en diferentes horarios ya que realiza sus recorridos cuando sus hijos están en clases, a veces va acompañada de su hijo menor ya que no asiste a la escuela. Con el préstamo Gloria comprar ropa, cosméticos y bisutería los productos que comercializa entre familiares, amigos y conocidos. A futuro ella desea comprar un carro y mejorar la casa donde vive.
texts.en: Gloria lives in the northern portion of Guayaquil known as Las Orquídeas.  She is 43 and makes a living selling beauty products and clothing by catalog.  She has had this business for 2 years, and she started it out of necessity since she is the single mother of 3 children.  She manages the business alone and during various hours since she makes her sales trips when her children are in school.  Sometimes her youngest son goes with her since he is not in school.  With this loan, Gloria will buy clothing, cosmetics, and costume jewelry, products that she will sell among family members, friends, and acquaintances.  In the future, she hopes to bu a car and to improve the house where she lives.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Yasser

texts.en:
Yasser is a 24-year-old young man. He is married and a father to one son.

For the past two years, Yasser has been operating a workshop for maintaining electricity generators. This has been a profitable project and the only source of income for the family, but also needs more support to cover the family's needs and the work costs.

Yasser is requesting a 1,500 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing a new kit for maintaining electricity generators. This will improve the quality of work and speed the process, which will help to improve the family's income and help them to live in better conditions.

Yasser is photographed in his workshop.

loans.use: to buy a new kit for maintaining electricity generators.

loans.name: Perpetua

texts.en: Perpetua is a 66-year-old woman who has been farming in the community of Talibon, Bohol. She is married with six grown children. Perpetua is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for her farm and pay for labor so she can be prepared for the season. The use of fertilizer attributes to a high yield of her crops, so she wanted to make sure that this is available in time. Her income will be used to buy her family's healthy diet and re-invest in the same business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en:
Magdaline is 27 years old and married with two children, ages seven and three years old.

Magdaline has a salon business that she has been doing for the past nine years. She has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy shampoos, a hair dryer, and towels to add to her stock.

She hopes to live a better life in the future and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy shampoos, a hair dryer, and towels to add to her stock.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a 40-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines whose husband is a fisherman in their area. They have been in the fishing business for 20 years now. She is asking for a loan to buy fishing materials such as fishing nets and other items. 

Catherine and her husband work hard to support their family, especially their eight children who are 18, 17, 14, 12, 10, 9, 5, and 3 years old. 

In the future, Catherine hopes to improve their fishing business so that they will be able to increase their family income. With the earnings that they will get from the business, Catherine and her husband will be able to send their children to school to attain higher levels of learning, which will be essential for a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials such as fishing nets

loans.name: Mt. Rungwe Group

texts.en:
Benadetha, who is in her early 30s, is married, with five children who go to school.  She has been a tailor for four years now.  She works from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily, and she is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be her second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to start selling fabrics.  She bought materials for making more clothes, and she paid school fees and household expenses.  She paid off that loan successfully. She wants a loan to buy more materials and fabrics. Her dream is one day to be able to build her own house

Benadetha will share this loan with her loan group "Mt. Rungwe," which has 16 members who will hold one other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more materials and fabrics for her tailoring  business.

loans.name: Julio Alejandro

texts.es:
El Señor Julio tiene 71 años de edad vive con su  familia, tiene 4 hijos, Su actividad principal es la agricultura, desde hace más de  40 años.
Don Julio, esta solicitando el apoyo del préstamo para la compra de productos como fertilizantes, herbicidas, abonos y otros productos para la buena preparación de sus tierras, con el apoyo solicitado del préstamo que reciba Don Julio, le ayudara a tener una buena cosecha este año por que comprara todo lo necesario, El es una persona muy trabajadora y toda su vida la a dedicado al trabajo de campo para darle el sustento a su familia y poder Salir adelante.
Don Julio sueña con tener unas tierras bien asistidas y poder sacar toda la cosecha ya que se necesita una gran inversión para poder lograr tener unos ahorros para que no falta nada en el hogar.
Danli El Paraíso, Honduras - Junio 2012
texts.en:
Julio is 71, and lives with his family. He has four children. For more than 40 years, his main livelihood has been farming.

Julio is requesting loan support for the purchase of products such as fertilizers, herbicides, manure and other products for the proper preparation of his land. The requested loan support Julio is getting will help him have a good harvest this year, because he will buy everything necessary. 

He is a very hard-working person, and has devoted his whole life to farmwork in order to provide for his family, and to be able to get ahead in life.

Julio dreams of having well-maintained land, and being able to remove the whole harvest. A considerable investment is needed to enable him to have some savings, so that his household lacks for nothing.

Danli El Paraiso, Honduras - June 2012

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, herbicides, manure, and other products for farming.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 23 years old and married to Dorcas. They have a son who is two years old.

Moses has a motorbike business that he has been doing for the past six years. He has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy spare parts and repair his motorbike.

He hopes to venture fully into the transport business and educate his children in the future.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and repair his motorbike.

loans.name: Gs Hombres De Valor Group

texts.es:
El Señor Sergio tiene 34 años de edad convive con su  familia, tiene 2 hijos, Su actividad principal es la agricultura, desde hace más de  20 años.
Don Sergio, esta solicitando el apoyo del préstamo para la compra de productos como ser: fertilizantes, herbicidas, abonos y otros productos para la buena preparación de sus tierras, con el apoyo solicitado del préstamo que reciba Don Sergio, le ayudara a tener una buena cosecha este año por que comprara todo lo necesario, El es una persona muy trabajadora y toda su vida la a dedicado al trabajo del campo para darle el sustento a su familia y poder Salir adelante.
Don Sergio sueña con tener unas tierras bien asistidas y poder sacar toda la cosecha el solicita el préstamo de manera grupal con las siguientes personas, Julio Su actividad  principal es la agricultura contando con mas de 30 años de experiencia en el manejo de este tipo de actividad  productiva y José su actividad  principal es la agricultura contando con más de 16 años de experiencia en el manejo de este tipo de actividad  productiva, siendo esta la principal fuente de sus ingresos.
Danli El Paraíso, Honduras - junio 2012
texts.en:
Sergio is 34, and lives with his family. He has two children. For more than 20 years, his main livelihood has been farming.

Sergio is applying for loan support in order to buy products such as fertilizers, herbicides, manure and other supplies for properly preparing his land. The requested loan support that Sergio will receive will help him have a good harvest this year, as he will buy everything necessary. 

He is a very hard-working person, and has devoted his entire life to farmwork, in order to provide for his family and be able to get ahead in life. 

Sergio dreams of having well-maintained land and being able to remove the entire harvest.

He is requesting the loan as part of a group with the following people: Julio, whose main livelihood is farming, and has more than 30 years experience in managing this type of activity; and José, whose main livelihood is farming, and has more than 30 years experience in managing this type of business, this being his main source of income.

Danli El Paraíso, Honduras - June 2012.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, herbicides, manure and other products for his business.

loans.name: Gs Estero Jutiapa Group

texts.es:
La Señora Candida tiene 48 años de edad y vive con su pareja, Su actividad principal es la venta de tortillas y verduras desde hace más de 10 años, Ella cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo.
Doña Candida, esta solicitando el apoyo para la compra de productos como ser: maíz, leña, tomates, cebollas chiles, repollos y otros productos de consumo para la buena atención de sus clientes, Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y se levanta muy temprano para la elaboración de su producto, con el apoyo solicitado del préstamo que reciba Doña Candida, le contribuirá a tener un mejor negocio, y así obtener mejores ingresos para cubrir los gastos en el hogar y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
Doña Candida sueña con tener una tortillera manual para incrementar sus ventas.
Silvia se dedica al comercio, su actividad principal es la elaboración de golosinas (nacatamales) desde hace 1 año, ella tiene 4 hijos y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo en los gastos familiares.
Martha se dedica al comercio, su actividad principal es la venta de nacatamales y tortillas y cuenta con 3 años de experiencia, Tiene 2 hijos y es viuda.
Danli El Paraíso, Honduras - Junio 2012
texts.en:
Candida is 48 years old and lives with her husband. Her main activity for more than 10 years has been the sale of tortillas and vegetables.  She  depends on the help of her husband.  Candida is applying for a loan to buy products such as corn, firewood, tomatoes, onions, chiles, cabbage, and other supplies to serve her customers well.  She is a very hard worker, and she wakes up very early in order to prepare her products.  With the help of the loan that she will receive, Candida will invest to better her business, and this will allow her to have better profits to cover bills in her household and to have a better quality of life.  Candida dreams of having a tortilla making machine to increase her sales.  

Silvia has focused mainly on the production of nacatamales (a food that consists of corn, meat, and rice wrapped and cooked in a banana leaf) for a year.  She has four children, and depends on her husband to help with the family expenditures.   

Martha has three years experience selling nacatamales and tortillas.  She has two children and is widowed.  

Danli El Paraiso, Honduras- June 2012

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, tomatoes, onions, chiles, cabbage, and other products for her business.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 23 years old, single, and supports three siblings from her family. She owns an M-pesa shop (a mobile-phone-based money-transfer service), a business she has been doing for the past three years. 

She wants to purchase mobile accessories to stock in her shop and has requested a second loan of KES 50,000. 

The profit from this business will help her open more branches and employ more people. Her dream is to be successful in life.

loans.use: To purchase mobile accessories to stock in her M-pesa shop for sale.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
This is Vilma, who previously accessed a 9,000 PHP loan that she utilized in buying school supplies to expand her product inventory. Her earnings were a big help for their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 11,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to purchase school supplies to expand her product inventory. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to cover their daily needs and educational expenses of her daughter. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Vilma hopes to grow and maintain the stability of her business in the coming years and dreams of giving her daughter a good, high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of school supplies and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Digna Birmania

texts.es: Digna se dedica a la venta de colas, jugos y snacks en su casa, la idea de este negocio se dio por si sola ya que frente a su domicilio hay una cancha de futbol. Hace 3 años que empezó el negocio y le va bien ya que hay mucho movimiento sobre todo los fines de semana. Realiza la venta acercandose a la cancha cuando hay juegos y vende por botellas o en vasos. Vive en la Libertad por lo que el clima ayuda a su negocio el cual atiende ella sola. Digna tiene 45 años y es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos pero solo uno vive con ella. El préstamo solicitado va a comprar colas y agua por cartones también snacks por fundas para la venta. La casa donde ella vive es de caña pero con bases de cemento por lo que su sueño es continuar con buen pie en el negocio para empezar poco a poco la construcción de toda la vivienda.
texts.en:
Digna makes a living selling sodas, juices and snacks in her house. She came up with this business idea on her own because at the front of her house there is a soccer field. She began this business three years ago and it's going very well since they is much activity, especially during the weekends. She makes her sales by going to the field when there are games and selling by the bottle or in glasses. 

She lives in La Libertad, which has a climate that helps her business which she attends to on her own. Digna is 45 years old and is a single mother. She has two children but only one lives with her. The requested loan will be used to buy sodas and containers of water, as well as bags of snacks to sell. The house she lives in is made of reeds but with a cement foundation. Her dream is to continue on the right path with the business to and little by little, to begin to build the house.

loans.use: to buy sodas, water and snacks.

loans.name: Jemimah

texts.en:
Jemimah is 45 years old, a married lady who has owned a  boutique shop in Mombasa for the past two years successfully. 

This is Jemimah’s first business loan from KADET LTD  to finance her business. She plans to purchase more shirts, blouses, trousers and handbags to sell to her customers. 


She will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan. She hopes to own a bigger boutique shop.

loans.use: to purchase more shirts, blouses, trousers and handbags

loans.name: Bibi

texts.en:
Bibi lives in Likoni, Kenya. She is engaged and is 24 years old. Bibi owns a mobile money transfer shop which has been in operation for one year. Besides this, she also runs a book shop and a soft drink outlet. She started the business from an informal saving scheme called ‘merry go round’; a process where individuals contribute same amount and lend it to one person in turn.

She was introduced to Milango by her friends and is applying for a loan of 43,200 Kenya shillings to add to her till float, purchase books and buy more soft drinks.

Bibi’s ambition is to open other outlets and the additional income from this business will help her buy household assets. The challenge has been with the limited float; a problem she hopes will be solved by the loan she has applied for.

loans.use: To add to her till float, purchase books and buy more soft drinks.

loans.name: Bashkim

texts.en:
Bashkim is from Kosovo. He is living in a Roma community. He is married and after 20 years of marriage he has only one child. For a long time now, he has been earning his living from selling hamburgers. Bashkim is a mobile seller. He travels a lot across Kosovo with his barbeque to sell hamburgers. 

He is requesting a loan to buy tables, chairs and an umbrella. 

He hopes to make good income and in the near future to have a shop and to offer better service to his customer. In this way he can improve the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: To buy tables, chairs and an umbrella

loans.name: Hekmat

texts.en:
Hekmat is a 44-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and five children, who are still attending school. He works in his town on a freelance basis carrying a trolley on which he places vegetables for vending. He makes a good income from his product sales, but he suffers financially, especially during disturbing weather since the selling rate is very low at this period as he faces difficulties in moving under the rain. 

This was the motive for him to request a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l., since he plans to purchase a minivan for his business so as to make his transportation safer and easier, and at the same time, increase his sales and thus his income. This will be his first Kiva loan, and he is sure that it will help him achieve remarkable growth in a short amount of time.

loans.use: to purchase a minivan for his business.

loans.name: Emerita

texts.es:
La Señora Emerita es una persona muy trabajadora dedicada a su trabajo. Actualmente vive con su esposo en el departamento de Choluteca Honduras. Y Se dedica a su negocio propio compra y venta de leña.
Doña Emerita el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de leña. En este tipo de negocio la venta es buena en todas las épocas de año. Ella Espera que al finalizar la temporada de invierno pueda tener un buen capital y bastante producto. Ya que es una zona muy productiva. Y a si tener más mercancía y de esta manera poder crecer con este tipo de negocio.
Doña Emerita desea Seguir trabajando muy duro para poder ayudar a sus hijos a tener una mejor educación.
Choluteca, Honduras - Junio 2012
texts.en:
Emerita is a very hard-working person, devoted to her work. Currently, she lives with her husband in Choluteca department, Honduras. She has her own business buying and selling firewood.

Emerita needs the loan to buy firewood. In this type of business, sales are good at all times of the year. 

She expects that by the end of the winter season, she will be able to have a good amount of working capital and sufficient product. This is because it is a very productive area. This way she will have more merchandise, and be able to prosper with this type of business.

Emerita wishes to keep working very hard, so that she can help her children have a better education. 

Choluteca, Honduras - June 2012

loans.use: To buy firewood for her business.

loans.name: Noel Agustin

texts.es: Noel Agustin de 37 años de edad casado , tiene por actividad economica venta de marisco como( pescado , boca colorada, curbina, lisa, camarones, jaiba, punches, concha, chanpainanos) ubicada en su casa de habitacion, en la cual tiene por experiencia 25 años , ya que desde muy temprana edad inicio el negocio con sus padres, en la actualidad ha crecido gracias a su esfuerzo personal , al apayo que leon 2000 le ha brindado, en conjunto con el programa kiva lo cual ha permito que su negocio sea prospero y rentable , por los financiamiento que le han brindado ya que mejorar las condiciones y calidad de sus productos.
texts.en: Noel Agustin is 37 years old and married.  He works selling seafood such as fish (boca colorada, curbina, lisa), shrimp, crab, crayfish, conch, and chanpainanos from his home.  He has 25 years of experience since he started this work from a young age with his parents.  Currently, the business has grown thanks to his personal effort, support that Leon 2000 has provided along with the Kiva program, which has allowed his business to be prosperous and profitable thanks to the loans that he has been given to improve conditions and the quality of his products.

loans.use: to purchase fish (boca colorada, curbina, lisa), shrimp, crab, crayfish, conch, and chanpainanos

loans.name: Nixsa Veronica

texts.es:
La Señora Nixsa es una persona muy trabajadora dedicada 100% a su trabajo. Actualmente vive con su madre y hermanos no tiene hijos, vive en el departamento de Choluteca Honduras. Y Se dedica a su negocio propio fábrica y venta de pan.
Doña Nixsa el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de harina, manteca, leña y azúcar. Este tipo de mercadería se vende mas en el verano.
Doña Nixsa espera que al finalizar la temporada de invierno pueda tener un buen capital y bastante producto. Ya que es una zona muy productiva, para tener más mercadería y de esta manera poder crecer con este tipo de negocio.
Doña Nixsa desea Seguir trabajando muy fuerte para poder ayudar a su madre y hermanos.
Choluteca, Honduras - Junio del 2012
texts.en:
Nixsa is a very hard-working person, dedicated 100% to her work.  She currently lives with her mother and siblings.  She doesn't have children and lives in the region of Choluteca, Honduras.  She works in her own business in which she makes and sells bread.  

Nixsa needs the loan to buy flour, butter, firewood and sugar.  This type of merchandise sells more in the summer.  Nixsa hopes that when the winter season ends, she will be able to have good capital and enough product.  Since it is a very productive region, having more merchandise will help this type of business be able to grow.

Nixsa wants to continue working very hard to be able to help her mother and siblings.

Choluteca, Honduras - June 2012

loans.use: to buy flour, butter, firewood and sugar for her business.

loans.name: Kenia Suyen

texts.es:
La joven Kenia es una persona muy trabajadora dedicada a su trabajo. Actualmente vive con su esposo en el departamento de Choluteca. Y Se dedica a su negocio propio fábrica y venta de tortillas.
Kenia el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de maíz, leña y cal. Este tipo de producto se vende en todas las épocas del año. 
Kenia Espera que al finalizar la temporada de invierno tener un buen capital y bastante producto. Y a si tener más producto y de esta manera poder crecer con este tipo de negocio.
Kenia desea seguir trabajando muy duro para poder ayudar a su familia especialmente a sus hijos.
Choluteca, Honduras - Junio del 2012
texts.en:
The young Kenia is a very hard working woman dedicated to her work. She lives her husband in the Choluteca department. She makes a living with her own business and sale of tortillas. 

Kenia needs this loan to buy corn, firewood and lime. This type of product is sold all year round. Kenia hopes that at the end of the winter season she will have a good amount of capital and enough product. With having more product she will be able to grow in this business. Kenia hopes to continue working very hard to be able to help her family, especially her children.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood and lime.

loans.name: Bun

texts.en:
Bun is 31 years old and a married woman living in Ang Snoul district. She earns a living by sewing clothes for a garment factory in Phnom Penh city. She earns a decent salary to spend on food and daily allowances for her young kid attending school. Bun’s husband also works for a small company to support his family.

Bun wants to have this loan to fix her present house because recently it’s suffered from the rain. Her house was built on the lower part of the land, and the water often comes into her house when there is a big rain. To solve the problem, she is asking for a loan to purchase building supplies such as cement, sand, and small stones to make a concrete floor. This will protect the family, especially during the rainy season.

loans.use: to purchase building supplies such as cement, sand, and small stones to make a concrete floor.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is a 50-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines who has been in a fishing venture together with her husband for about five years now. At this time, she is asking for a loan worth 5000 PHP which she will use to buy additional fish netting and for the maintenance of their fishing materials. Esterlita believes that this loan would be a great help because it will give them the resources that they need for the improvement of their fishing business.

Esterlita works really hard just to help her husband in providing for the needs of the entire family, especially for their four young children. 

She hopes that their fishing business would develop and grow so that it could help them in providing and in meeting their needs. Moreover, she can continually send her children to school and provide their basic needs and healthcare.
