Haitham  is requesting a 1,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing a new collection of summer clothes to re-sell. This will enable Haitham to compete well with others, which will mean that sales will increase, improving the family's income.

Haitham is photographed next to his stall.

loans.use: To purchase clothes to re-sell.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is married with three children aged between three and seven. The oldest attend school. His wife works as a business woman. He has been a maize farmer for three years. He would like to get this loan to buy more seeds and seed multiplication and pay for additional labor so he can get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to pay school fees, and make savings.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more seeds and seed multiplication and pay additional labor costs.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle, 43, is a married woman with four children residing in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She buys and sells fish for a living, a business she has had for eight years. Each month, she earns 8,000 PHP from her business.

Annabelle has requested a loan of 13,000 PHP to purchase more fish to sell. She joined GDMPC in 2011. In the future, Annabelle hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus is a single man. He has no children yet but plans to have a family. He describes himself as a patient and visionary man. Justus operates a retail store where he provides maize grinding services. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a strategic area and his primary customers are local residents.

Justus describes frequent power blackouts as his biggest business challenge. He will use the KES 5,800 loan to buy a solar lantern. His business goal is to run a cereal retail store within five years.

loans.use: to buy a solar lantern.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 32 years old, is married and has three children. She sells clothes to earn a living in a busy environment with frequent customers. Margaret has been in this business for four years and has one employee. She also depends on her husband's salary. 

Margaret had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya which helped her to grow her business. She has also learnt the importance of saving because she has been trained in financial management. She dreams of importing clothes for resale in the future. She needs a loan of 60,000 KES to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Bulganjargal

texts.en:
Mrs. Bulganjargal, 30, runs a grocery store in a supermarket. She started her business last year and has earned a decent profit. Currently it is a main income source for her family. His husband helps her to run their business. 

She lives with her husband and her daughter in the ger district, an area of city with no running water, minimal roads and spotty electricity in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Actually she is an accountant, but still she has not been employed in a field related to her studies. 

She is taking a loan to buy some groceries to increase the stock of her grocery store. In addition she has a plan to start a second business such as a beauty salon after her grocery business has stabilised.

loans.use: To buy some groceries to increase the stock in her grocery store.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 33 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Remedios runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Remedios has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as soap, shampoo, canned goods, noodles, etc.. 

In the future Remedios would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is 40 years old and single with one child. Annabelle works very hard to provide for them.

Annabelle runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy a stock of groceries to sell in her store.

Annabelle has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, detergent and other school supplies. 

In the future Annabelle would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Renalyn

texts.en:
Renalyn works hard to support her family. Renalyn is married and has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines.

Renalyn requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional rice to sell.

Renalyn has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Renalyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additonal rice to sell.

loans.name: Anabel Viviana

texts.es:
Anabel tiene 40 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Santiago, Ica, Perú. Santiago. El distrito de Santiago se caracteriza por su agricultura en especial el cultivo de algodón, uva, esparrago, frejoles, entre otros.  Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho pasar un tiempo de familia ya que es madre de 4 hijos cuyas edades comprenden 14,11,9 y 3 años a quienes quiere mucho y sobre todo trabaja mucho para sacarlos adelante y poder darles una vida digna y sobre todo con amor y cariño. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos ella solo pudo estudiar hasta tercer grado de secundaria pero le hubiera gustado estudiar para ser profesora.

Día a día Anabel trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de golosinas a las afueras de los colegios de su distrito, ella trabaja alrededor e 8 horas al día y puede atender hasta 20 clientes en el día en especial los niños quienes son los que comprar la mayoría de sus productos; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque tiene mucha paciencia con los niños y los trata de manera amable.

Anabel está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprare mercadería para su negocio como galletas, chocolates, caramelos, gaseosas, entre otros, así ella podrá tener más variedad de productos y podrá mejorar sus ingresos y seguir trabajando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Anabel is 40 years old and lives in Santiago district, Ica, Peru.  Santiago district is known for its agriculture, especially its cotton, grape, asparagus and bean growing.  Whenever she has any free time, Anabel really enjoys spending time with her family as she is the mother of four children who are 14, 11, 9 and 3 years old.  She loves them dearly and works hard to provide for them and ensure they have a decent life.  Above all, she gives them a lot of love and affection.  Owing to her limited financial resources, Anabel was only able to study up to the third year of her secondary education but she would have liked to have gone on to become a teacher.  

Anabel works every day in her small business selling candies outside the schools in her district.  She works around 8 hours a day and can serve up to 20 customers a day.  Her main customers are children.  They are the ones who buy most of her products.  She believes that her business is doing well because she has a lot of patience with the children and treats them kindly.

Anabel is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, she will be able to buy merchandise for her business such as cookies, chocolates, candies, soda, etc.  She will have a greater variety of products and will be able to improve her income and continue working every day to fulfill her biggest dream: to own her own home.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (cookies, chocolates, candies, soda, etc.)

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 32 years old, is married and has two children. He sells clothes to earn a living. He operates his business in a busy environment with reliable customers. 

Through Faulu Kenya, Simon has learnt how to invest because he has been trained in financial management. He hopes to expand his business in the future. He needs a loan of 20,000 KES to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a basket-weaving business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years. Rosalia earns additional income from pig fattening.

Rosalia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy materials needed for her business. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her business.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia, 57, lives in Danao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is married with eight children.

Lilia works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 30 years. She has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase boxes of assorted fish for resale. 

Lilia has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, she hopes to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase boxes of assorted fish for resale.

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline is a 26-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. She runs a motorcycle business and has been for five years now. This business earns enough to provide for their financial needs. Angeline is asking for a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy spare parts for the motorcycle and for its maintenance. 

In the future, Angeline hopes to improve her current business and to try a new one to double earnings. That way she will be able to send her children to school and experience the so-called fullness of life.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and to maintain the motorcycle.

loans.name: Lucero

texts.es:
Lucero es una joven de 22 años de edad, la cual vive en l el distrito de Parcona. El distrito de Parcona se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura y la ganadería, también se le conoce por la amabilidad de sus pobladores. Lucero en su tiempo libre le gusta mucho bailar y sobre todo en ocasiones le gusta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con –pato”. Ella solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar para ser Ingeniera de Alimentos.

Día a día Lucero trabaja en su negocio de venta de adornos para el hogar así como también la venta de uno de los dulces típicos de la zona como son las chocotejas, ella trabaja alrededor de 6horas al día y puede atender hasta 10 clientes diariamente; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque ofrece productos de calidad y tiene muy buena sazón para la preparación de las chocotejas.

Lucero está muy agradecida con los  prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar 2 vitrinas para poder exhibir sus productos y también comprar gaseosas al por mayor para ofrecer a los clientes, de esta manera tendrá mejores ingresos y podrá seguir trabajando y poder seguir luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su tienda de bazar”.
texts.en:
Lucero is a young woman of 22 who lives in Parcona district.  Parcona district is known for its warm climate, its farming and livestock raising, and also for the friendliness of the locals.  In her free time, Lucero really enjoys dancing and she also enjoys eating one of her favorite dishes, the delicious 'arroz con pato' (rice with duck).  She only finished high school but would have liked to have studied to become a food engineer.

Lucero works every day in her business selling household decorations.  She also sells a traditional sweet treat from her area called 'chocotejas' (chocolate coated fruit and nuts).  She works around 6 hours a day and can serve up to 10 customers a day.  She believes that her business is doing well because she sells good-quality products and her chocotejas are very tasty.

Lucero is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, she will be able to buy two display cases in which to display her products.  She will also buy soda wholesale to offer her customers.  This will make her better income and she will be able to continue working hard to fulfill her biggest dream: to own a store.

loans.use: to buy display cases

loans.name: Batsaikhan

texts.en:
Batsaikhan, aged 31, is a geologist and has been working according to his major in a private company for a decade. Batsaikhan lives with his wife and his two children in his common apartment which is in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He is requesting a loan to repair his apartment. His family has been living in this apartment for many years and usually can’t completely renovate it. 

Batsaikhan will use his loan to replace the dated wooden floor and windows and replace wall insulation with new insulation due to too much heat loss and emission through them. In winter, he uses a water-heated furnace to stay warm at home. It takes too much water and is very wasteful of water. As he said, "if I can make my planned repairs, my cost of heating will be cut notably and it will be one of my contributions to the environment".

loans.use: To repair his apartment.

loans.name: Lesian

texts.en:
Lesian is 28 years old. He sells milk to make a living, operating a mobile business with reliable customers. Lesian has been in this business since 2005. He has previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya which helped him grow his business. 

Lesian has also been able to manage his business because he has been trained in business management. He hopes to own a wholesale business in the future. He needs a loan of 30,000 KES to buy a freezer, milk and two goats.

loans.use: To buy a freezer, milk and two goats

loans.name: Geyda Rosario

texts.es:
Geyda es una joven de 20 años de edad, es madre de una pequeña a cual tiene 1 añito, su vivienda se ubica en el distrito de Parcona. El distrito de Parcona se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura y la ganadería, también se le conoce por la amabilidad de sus pobladores. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta salir a pasear con su pequeña y comparte con ella un tiempo de unión y amor, asimismo en ocasiones le gusta darse el gusto de comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con Pato”. Ella solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar la carrera de administración.

Con mucho entusiasmo Geyda trabaja en su negocio de venta de ropa para niños, damas y caballeros, venta de mochilas, entre otros, ella trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día y puede atender hasta 15 clientes diariamente; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio ya que es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque tiene mucha paciencia con los clientes.

Geyda está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio como pantalones, chompas, buzos, entre otros, así de esta manera tendrá mayor variedad de productos y podrá mejorar sus ingresos para así poder cumplir su más grande sueño:” Ser una gran empresaria”.
texts.en:
Geyda is a young woman of 20 and the mother of a little girl who is just 1 year old.  Her home is located in Parcona district.  Parcona district is known for its warm climate, its farming and livestock raising, and also for the friendliness of the locals.  Whenever she has any free time, Geyda enjoys going out for walks with her little one and sharing time and love with her.  She sometimes enjoys eating one of her favorite dishes, the delicious "arroz con pato" (rice with duck).  Geyda only managed to finish high school but she would have liked to have gone on to study for a management degree.

Geyda works enthusiastically in her business selling men's, women's and children's clothing.  She also sells backpacks and other products.  She works around 8 hours a day and can serve up to 15 customers a day.  She believes that her business is doing well because she is very friendly to her customers and has a lot of patience with them.

Geyda is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, she will be able to buy merchandise for her business such as pants, sweaters, track suits, etc.  This will give her a greater variety of products and she will be able to improve her income so that she can fulfill her biggest dream: to become a great businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (pants, sweaters, track suits, etc.)

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is 62 years old and married with two children. Belinda works hard to provide for her family. She has been running a general store in the Philippines for the past 16 years. 

Belinda has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She is now requesting a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. Belinda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Mwanamkuu

texts.en:
Mwanamkuu, aged 30, has lived with her lifetime companion and their three children in their own house for over six years. She owns a store where she sells charcoal, and she also sells cashew nuts from her home, and these help her to cover her household expenses. She is well-known in the area and has many customers. She has the advantage of not having much competition around. People prefer her store because she is always very welcoming and gives good service.

Mwanamkuu is a very hard-working woman, always ready to take on any opportunity that presents itself in order to be successful. One of her biggest dreams is to increase her business and ensure that all her children become professionals. She needs capital that will allow her to purchase more sacks of charcoal and cashew nuts to sell and, in addition, she wants to start a clothes-selling business.

Mwanamkuu has a good credit history and is very responsible. She knows that she can cover the debt and, at the same time, give her family a better quality of life thanks to her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal, cashew nuts and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies for making food as her current supplies are running out

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is from Poblacion, Sapang Dalaga, Calamba. She is 62 years old and is married with four children. Flora prepares and sells cooked food for daily meals. She has been in her business for eight years and earns 10,000 PHP a month. 

In 2009, Flora joined GDMPC. Flora is requesting a loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make dishes. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make dishes.

loans.name: Cecil

texts.en:
Cecil is 27 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. Cecil has been running a general store in the Philippines for the past two years.
 
She has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. Cecil is now requesting a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure her family's financial stability.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell

loans.name: Adriana Maria

texts.es:
Adriana abrió la tienda general desde hace aproximadamente 4 años con el ánimo de generar ingresos para su hogar y contribuir económicamente, pues su esposo gana un salario que no es suficiente para sostener los gastos que se generan en el hogar donde conviven con sus 8 hijos de 3, 6, 7, 8, 11, 14, 15, y 17 años de edad. Gracias a que una amiga suya trabajaba en una distribuidora de productos de la canasta familiar y los vendía al por mayor, Adriana se animó a abrir su tienda con las enseñanzas que le daba su amiga, y ahora que tiene su tienda bien montada puede gozar de una mejor calidad de vida para todo su hogar gracias a los ingresos que provienen de su tienda. Adriana busca un préstamo para comprar productos de la canasta familiar que ya se están agotando en su tienda.

De esta manera seguirá ofreciendo a sus clientes buena variedad de productos y así podrá tener unos buenos ingresos para su hogar. Su mayor sueño es lograr tener un minimercado donde pueda generar empleo para las personas más necesitadas.
texts.en: Adriana opened her general store approximately four years ago with the aim of making income for her household and contributing financially as her husband earns a salary which isn't large enough to cover their household expenses.  Adriana and her husband live with their eight children who are 3, 6, 7, 8, 11, 14, 15 and 17 years old.  As she had a friend who used to work at a suppliers where they sold basic household products wholesale, Adriana decided to open a store with advice from her friend.  She now has a well-established store and her whole household is able to enjoy a better quality of life thanks to the income that she makes in her store.  Adriana is looking for a loan to buy basic household products as her stock is running low.  This will enable her to continue offering her customers a good variety of products and she will continue making good income for her household.  Her biggest dream is to have a minimart where she can create jobs for those who are most in need.

loans.use: to buy basic household products because her stock is running low

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a hard-working businessman and has two children. He operates a cafeteria to earn a living. He has been in this business since 2008 and has three employees. 

Through Faulu Kenya, George has learnt how to manage his business because he has been trained in business management. He dreams of opening another outlet in a different location and buying a plot of land in the future. George has requested a loan of 100,000 KES to buy cooking oil and maize flour.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil and maize flour

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en:
Oyunchimeg is 41 years old and lives with her husband and his son in the ger district, an area of the city with no running water, minimal roads and erratic electricity in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has worked as a vendor in the supermarket for the last six years. 

Her husband, Ganzorig, aged 46, is not employed and is planning to start a taxi business to earn income for his family. So Oyunchimeg is requesting a loan to pay for her husband’s purchase of a second-hand car to use as a taxi. As she said, "it will be a big help to me if my husband could start his business".

loans.use: To pay for her husband’s purchase of a second-hand car for use as a taxi.

loans.name: Niceletha

texts.en:
Niceletha is married to a teacher and they have three children. She has been a maize farmer for four years. She would like to get this loan to buy more seeds and seed multiplication, and to support labor costs to get the best harvest. With the profits, she plans to make savings.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more seeds and seed multiplication, and to support labor costs.

loans.name: Deisy Tatiana

texts.es:
Deisy es una joven emprendedora de 21 años de edad que al ver las pocas oportunidades que se le presentaban tanto para estudiar como para trabajar, decidió montar su propio negocio en búsqueda de una prosperidad económica tanto para ella como para su familia. Sin mucha experiencia en la actividad y aprovechando algunos conocimientos que tenía de informática adquiridos en su estudio, Deisy montó una papelería donde también ofrece el servicio de cibercafé a sus clientes, y con este negocio puede generar ingresos con los cuales contribuye económicamente en su hogar y también ahorra para poder pagarse sus estudios universitarios. Gracias a que trabaja fuertemente en su negocio todos los días y cada vez se esfuerza más para hacerlo crecer, su negocio ha logrado captar una gran cantidad de clientes y esto le garantiza muy buenas ventas. Con el ánimo de seguir respondiendo a la demanda de sus clientes, Deisy requiere un préstamo para comprar productos de papelería y comprar un computador para abastecer la demanda de sus clientes.

De esta manera su negocio seguirá creciendo y así seguirá ofreciendo cada vez una mejor atención a sus clientes, de modo que sus ventas aumentarán y así lo harán sus ingresos, permitiendo brindar una mejor calidad de vida en su familia y ahorrando más para poder tener sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en: Deisy is an entrepreneurial young woman of 21 who, aware of the lack of opportunities available to her for either studying or working, decided to set up her own business in search of financial prosperity for both herself and her family.  Without a lot of experience in the business but making the most of some IT skills she gained at school, Deisy set up a stationery store where she also offers an Internet cafe service to her customers.  This business enables her to make income and contribute financially to her household.  She is also saving up so that she can pay for a university education for herself.  Thanks to the fact that she works hard every day and continues to put in more and more work in order to grow her business, she has managed to attract a large number of customers.  This guarantees her very good sales.  With the aim of continuing to respond to her customers' demands, Deisy needs a loan so that she can buy stationery products and a computer.  This will allow her business to continue growing and she will be able to continue improving her customer service.  As a result, her sales and her income will increase, allowing her to provide her family with a better quality of life and enabling her to save more money to pay for her university studies.

loans.use: to buy stationery products and a computer so that she can meet her customers' demands
